en: We cheered and shook our swords and followed her down the path to the south woods. The red team yelled taunts at us as they headed off toward the north.
vi: Cả đội hò reo, vung kiếm theo Annabeth theo đường mòn xuống phía nam khu rừng. Ðội đỏ vừa tiến về phương Bắc vừa mắng nhiếc xỉ vả chúng tôi.
vi_results: "title": "Percy Jackson và Olympian: Cuộc chiến cuối cùng", "author": "Rick Riordan"
tr: Hep beraber bağırdık, kılıçlarımızı salladık ve onun peşinde güney koruluğa giden patikadan aşağı inmeye başladık. Kırmızı takım sinirlerimizi bozmak için küfürler savurup kuzeye yol aldı.
es: Vitoreamos, agitamos nuestras armas y la seguimos por el camino hacia la parte sur del bosque. El equipo rojo nos provocaba a gritos mientras se encaminaba hacia el norte.
vi_translation: The whole team cheered, swinging their swords as they followed Annabeth down the trail to the south of the forest. The red team advanced north while hurling insults at us.
tr_translation: We all shouted together, waved our swords, and began to descend the path leading to the southern grove in pursuit of him. The red team hurled curses to rattle our nerves and headed north.
es_translation: We cheered, waved our weapons, and followed her down the path towards the southern part of the forest. The red team taunted us with shouts as they headed north.

en: By some miracle, I was still alive. I didn’t want to look underneath the ruins of my shredded armor. My chest felt warm and wet, and I knew I was badly cut. Another second, and the monster would’ve turned me into a hundred pounds of delicatessen meat.
vi: Tôi còn sống như có phép màu. Tôi sợ không dám nhìn xuống tấm áo giáp tả tơi. Thấy ngực mình ươn ướt, âm ấm, tôi biết mình bị thương nặng. Chỉ chậm một giây thôi là quái thú sẽ biến tôi thành súc thịt vô tri nặng năm chục ký lô.
vi_results: "title": "Truyện ngắn của nhà văn Nguyễn Công Hoan", "author": "Nguyễn Công Hoan"
tr: Mucize kabilinden hayattaydım. Lime lime olmuş zırhımın altına bakacak gücüm yoktu. Göğsüm yanıyordu ve ıpıslaktı, çok kötü yaralandığımı biliyordum. Bir saniye gecikseler, canavar beni elli kiloluk kıymaya çevirirdi.
es: Por algún milagro, yo seguía vivo. No quise mirar debajo de mi armadura despedazada. Sentía el pecho caliente y húmedo, sin duda tenía cortes muy feos. Un segundo más y el animal me habría convertido en picadillo fino.
vi_translation: I am still alive as if by a miracle. I am too scared to look down at my tattered armor. Feeling my chest wet and warm, I know I am seriously injured. Just a second slower and the beast would have turned me into fifty kilograms of lifeless meat.
tr_translation: I was alive by a miracle. I had no strength to look under my shredded armor. My chest was burning and soaking wet; I knew I was badly injured. If they had been a second late, the monster would have turned me into fifty kilos of minced meat.
es_translation: By some miracle, I was still alive. I didn't want to look under my shattered armor. I felt my chest hot and wet, undoubtedly I had some very nasty cuts. One more second and the animal would have turned me into fine mince.
st: Ka mohlolo, ke ne ke sa ntse ke phela. Ke ne ke sa batle ho sheba ka tlasa lihlomo tsa ka tse senyehileng. Sefuba sa ka se ne se futhumetse ebile se le metsi, 'me ke ne ke tseba hore ke fokotsoe. E 'ngoe ea bobeli, 'me phoofolo ea tonanahali e ne e tla fetoha nama e boima ea lik'hilograma tse lekholo.

en: The attic was filled with Greek hero junk: armor stands covered in cobwebs; once-bright shields pitted with rust; old leather steamer trunks plastered with stickers saying ITHAKA, CIRCE’S ISLE, and LAND OF THE AMAZONS. One long table was stacked with glass jars filled with pickled things-severed hairy claws, huge yellow eyes, various other parts of monsters. A dusty mounted trophy on the wall looked like a giant snake’s head, but with horns and a full set of shark’s teeth. The plaque read, HYDRA HEAD #1, WOODSTOCK, N.Y., 1969.
en_results: "title": "Percy Jackson and the Lightning Thief", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi: Căn gác xép bừa bội đồ đạc hư hỏng của chiến binh Hy Lạp cổ: bộ giáp trụ vùi trong đống mạng nhện, vài cái khiên rỉ sét, mấy hòm xiểng lớn bằng da nhằng nhịt giấy dán những chữ như: Ithaka, Quần Đảo Vòng và Vùng Đất Của Các Nữ Vương. Một chiếc bàn dài xếp dầy hũ thủy tinh đựng đồ ngâm dấm: vài móng thú đầy lông, đống tròng mắt vàng khè, to như chén tống và nhiều bộ phận cơ thể của quái vật. Một chiếc cúp bám đầy bụi treo trên tường trông giống đầu rắn nhưng lại có sừng, miệng đầy răng cá mập. Tấm bảng đồng bên dưới đề: Đầu thứ nhất của Hydra, Woodstock, NY, 1969.
tr: Tavan arası Yunan kahramanlardan kalma çerçöple doluydu: örümcek ağları ile kaplı zırhlıklar; vaktiyle parlakken, pastan çukur çukur olmuş kalkanlar; üstlerine İTHAKA, KİRKE ADASI ve AMAZONLAR DİYARI yazan çıkartmalarla bezeli, deri kaplı eski sandıklar. Uzunca bir masanın üstündeise turşusu kurulmuş şeyler ile dolu cam kavanozlar diziliydi: üstü kıllarla kaplı kopmuş, kocaman sarı gözler, başka çeşitli canavar parçaları. Duvara tutturulmuş, içi doldurulmuş bir kafanın her yanı tozla kaplıydı. Bu kafa dev bir yılanın kafasına benziyordu ama boynuzları ve köpekbalığı dişleri vardı. Altındaki levhada şöyle yazıyordu: HİDRA KAFASI No: 1, WOODSTOCK, NEW YORK, 1969.
es: El ático estaba lleno de trastos viejos de héroes griegos: armaduras cubiertas de telarañas; escudos antaño relucientes y ahora manchados de orín; baúles viejos de cuero con pegatinas en las que se leía: «ÍTACA», «isla de circe» y «PAÍS DE las AMAZONAS». Había una mesa larga atestada de tarros con cosas encurtidas: garras peludas troceadas, enormes ojos amarillos, distintas partes de monstruo. En la pared destacaba un trofeo polvoriento; parecía la cabeza gigante de una serpiente, pero tenía cuernos y una fila entera de dientes de tiburón. En la placa ponía: «cabeza n.° i de la hidra, woods TOCK, N. Y., 1969.»
vi_translation: The cluttered attic of a Greek warrior's damaged belongings: armor buried in cobwebs, a few rusty shields, several large leather chests covered with labels bearing words like: Ithaka, the Cyclades, and the Land of the Queens. A long table filled with glass jars containing pickled items: a few furry animal claws, a pile of yellowish eyeballs as big as bowls, and many body parts of monsters. A dust-covered trophy hanging on the wall that looks like a snake's head but has horns and a mouth full of shark teeth. The brass plaque underneath reads: First head of the Hydra, Woodstock, NY, 1969.
tr_translation: The attic was filled with junk from Greek heroes: armor covered in cobwebs; shields that were once shiny but now pitted with rust; old leather-covered chests adorned with stickers reading ITHACA, CIRCE'S ISLAND, and LAND OF THE AMAZONS. On a long table, there were glass jars filled with pickled things: huge yellow eyes covered in hair, various other monster parts. A stuffed head mounted on the wall was covered in dust. This head resembled that of a giant snake but had horns and shark teeth. The plaque beneath it read: HYDRA HEAD No: 1, WOODSTOCK, NEW YORK, 1969.
es_translation: The attic was full of old junk from Greek heroes: armors covered in cobwebs; shields once shiny and now stained with rust; old leather trunks with stickers that read: "ITHACA," "island of circe," and "LAND OF the AMAZONS." There was a long table crowded with jars of pickled things: chopped hairy claws, huge yellow eyes, various monster parts. On the wall, a dusty trophy stood out; it looked like the giant head of a serpent, but it had horns and an entire row of shark teeth. On the plaque it said: "head no. i of the hydra, woods TOCK, N. Y., 1969."
st: Attic e ne e tletse Segerike mohale junk: lihlomo li eme ka cobwebs; li-shields tse nang le li-fungus tse nang le mafome; Likutu tsa khale tsa letlalo la li-steamer tse plastered ka lithupa tse reng ITHAKA, CIRCE'S ISLE, le NAHA EA AMAZONS. Tafole e 'ngoe e telele e ile ea stacked le li-nkho tsa khalase tse tletseng li-pickled li-claws tse thata, mahlo a maholo a mosehla, likarolo tse ling tse sa tšoaneng tsa litonanahali. Trophy e nang le lerōle le neng le leboteng e ne e shebahala joalo ka hlooho ea noha e kholo, empa e na le linaka le sehlopha se felletseng sa meno a shark. Letlapa le baloa, HYDRA HEAD # 1, WOODSTOCK, N.Y., 1969.
yo: Àjà náà kún fún ìdọ̀tí akọni Greek: àwọn ibùdó ìhámọ́ra tí wọ́n bò pẹ̀lú cobwebs; lọgan-imọlẹ shields pitted pẹlu ipata; Àwọn ẹ̀wù steamer awọ àtijọ́ tí wọ́n fi àwọn àlẹ̀mọ́ ṣe tí wọ́n ń sọ pé ITHAKA, CIRCE's ISLE, àti LAND OF THE AMAZONS. Tábìlì gígùn kan ni wọ́n kó jọ pẹ̀lú àwọn ìkòkò gíláàsì tí ó kún fún èékánná irun tí wọ́n gé àwọn nkan tí wọ́n gé, ojú òféèfé ńlá, oríṣiríṣi àwọn ẹ̀yà ẹranko mìíràn. Ife-ẹ̀yẹ tí ó ní eruku lórí ògiri dàbí orí ejò ńlá, ṣùgbọ́n pẹ̀lú ìwo àti àkójọpọ̀ eyín ẹja ṣáàkì. Àmì náà kà, HYDRA HEAD #1, WOODSTOCK, NY, 1969.
tn: O ne a tletse ka sethunya sa segerika se se nang le serolwana se se nang le serolwana se se nang le di-cobwebs; 12.10 Di-sy-1000 di ne di le teng ka di-seds tse di nang le ruse; Di-sys tsa kgale tsa letlalo tse neng di le teng ka di-stickers tse neng di bua ka ithaka, circe's isle, le lefatshe la amazons. Tafole e nngwe e telele e ne e tletse ka di-pickles tse nang le moriri o boima, mahlo a makgetla a masweu, dikarolo tse ding tse fapa-fapaneng tsa dimonamona. Mo godimo ga moo, go ne go lebega e kete ke tlhogo ya noga e kgolo, mme e na le dinaka le meno a a tletseng a shark. Go GoA Gone - 1969, Woodstock, N., Y., 1969.
ty: Ua î roa te piha vairaa tauhaa i te mau aito Heleni : ua tapo'ihia te mau paruru i te mau tapo'i fare ; ua î te reira i te tutae auri; ua î roa te mau tumu raau tahito i te mau raau tapiri e parauhia RA EHAKA, CIRCE'S ISLE, e LAND OF THE AMAZONS. Ua apapa noa te hoê iri amuraa maa roa i te mau farii hi'o tei î i te mau hu'ahu'a hi'o, te mau mata re'are'a re'are'a, e te tahi atu mau tuhaa o te mau mea rarahi. E au te hoê re repo puehu i nia i te patu i te upoo o te hoê ophi rahi, e te mau tara râ e te mau niho o te ma'o. Ua tai'ohia i roto i te buka iti, HYDRA HEAD #1, WOODSTOCK, N.Y., 1969.
mai: अटारी यूनानी नायकक कबाड़सँ भरल छल: कवच कोबलामे झाँपल अछि; एक बेर उज्ज्वल ढाल जंग सं ठाढ़ अछि। पुरान चमड़ाक स्टीमर ट्रंक पर स्टीकर लागल छल जाहि पर लिखल छल इथाका, सर्सेस आइल, आ लैंड ऑफ द अमेजन। एकटा नमगर टेबुल पर अचार बला चीजसँ भरल काँचक जारसँ भरल छल-कटल केशवला पंजा, विशाल पीयर आँखि, राक्षसक विभिन्न अन्य भाग। दीवार पर एकटा धूल भरल चढ़ल ट्रॉफी एकटा विशाल साँपक माथ जकाँ देखाइत छल, मुदा सींग आ शार्कक दाँतक पूरा सेट छल। पट्टिका पर लिखल छल, हाइड्रा हेड #१, वुडस्टॉक, एन.वाई., १९६९।
mg: Feno maherifo grika ny efitra ambanin'ny riaka: fitoeran-tavin-tsoavaly feno cobwebs; indray mandeha mamirapiratra ampinga feno harafesina; Vatan-kazo vita amin'ny hoditra efa tranainy nolalorina tamin'ny taratasy kely milaza Ithaka, Nosy Circe, ary TANIN'I AMAZONA. Latabatra lava iray no feno siny fitaratra feno volo mivolom-bolo, maso mavo lehibe, faritra maro hafa amin'ireo biby mahatsiravina. Toy ny lohan'ny bibilava goavana ny amboaran - dandy feno vovoka teo amin'ny rindrina, nefa nisy tandroka sy nifin'ny antsantsa feno. Mivaky toy izao ilay takelaka, HYDRA HEAD #1, WOODSTOCK, N.Y., 1969.

en: I got the feeling there was a lot he wasn’t telling me about his prophecy, but I decided I couldn’t worry about that right now. After all, I was holding back information too.
en_results: "title": "The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones", "author": "Cassandra Clare"
vi: Biết bác Chiron giấu nhiều chi tiết của lời tiên đoán tương lai đã nghe lúc trước, nhưng tôi quyết định tạm gác chuyện đó lại. Nói cho cùng, chính tôi cũng không nói hết cơ mà.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Hòn Đá Vàng", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Bana kendi kehaneti ile ilgili söylemediği çok şey olduğunu hissediyordum ama şimdi bunu dert edemem diye düşündüm. Ne de olsa benim de söylemediklerim vardı.
es: Intuí que me estaba ocultando buena parte de su profecía, pero decidí que ahora no podía preocuparme por eso. Después de todo, también yo me estaba guardando información.
vi_translation: Knowing that Mr. Chiron had hidden many details of the future prediction he had heard earlier, I decided to set that matter aside for now. After all, I didn't reveal everything either.
tr_translation: I felt that there were many things he hadn't told me about his prophecy, but I thought I couldn't worry about that now. After all, I had things I hadn't said either.
es_translation: I sensed that he was hiding a good part of his prophecy from me, but I decided that I couldn't worry about that now. After all, I was also keeping information to myself.
st: Ke na le maikutlo a mangata ao a neng a sa mpolella ka boprofeta ba hae, empa ke nkile qeto ea hore nke ke ka tšoenyeha ka seo hajoale. Ha e le hantle, ke ne ke boetse ke na le boitsebiso bo ka morao.
yo: Mo ní ìmọ̀lára pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ nkan ló wà tí kò sọ fún mi nípa àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ rẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n mo pinnu pé mi ò lè dààmú nípa ìyẹn báyìí. Lẹ́yìn gbogbo rẹ̀, èmi náà ń dá ìròyìn dúró.

en: “The entrance to the Underworld is always in the west. It moves from age to age, just like Olympus. Right now, of course, it’s in America.”
vi: - Lối vào cõi âm luôn ở hướng Tây. Giống đỉnh Olympia, nó cũng chuyển địa điểm theo thời gian. Tất nhiên lúc này nó ở Mỹ.
vi_results: "title": "The Particular Sadness of Lemon Cake", "author": "Aimee Bender"
tr: "Yeraltı Dünyası'na giriş her zaman batıdadır. Çağdan çağa yer değiştirir, tıpkı Olimpos gibi. Elbette şimdi Amerika'da.
es: —La entrada al inframundo está siempre en el oeste. Se desplaza de época en época, como el Olimpo. Justo ahora, por supuesto, está en Estados Unidos.
vi_translation: - The entrance to the underworld is always in the West. Like Mount Olympus, it also changes location over time. Of course, right now it is in America.
tr_translation: "The entrance to the Underworld is always in the west. It changes location from age to age, just like Olympus. Of course, now it is in America."
es_translation: —The entrance to the underworld is always in the west. It shifts from era to era, like Olympus. Right now, of course, it's in the United States.
st: "Ho kena ka tlas'a lefatše ho lula ho le bophirima. E tsamaea ho tloha botsofaling ho isa ho lilemo, joalo ka Olympus. Ha e le hantle, e se e ntse e le United States. "
yo: "Ẹnu-ọna si Underworld nigbagbogbo wa ni iwọ-oorun. Ó ń lọ láti ọjọ́ orí dé ọjọ́ orí, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Olympus. Ní báyìí, dájúdájú, ó wà ní America."

en: I stopped myself because I was about to sound like a brat. I was wishing my dad had given me a cool magic item to help on the quest, something as good as Luke’s flying shoes, or Annabeth’s invisible cap.
vi: Tôi im bặt, biết mình vừa suy nghĩ như đứa con hay vòi vĩnh. Tôi ước cha cho tôi một vật màu nhiệm có thể giúp tôi thực hiện nhiệm vụ này: một món đồ hữu dụng như giày biết bay của Luke hay mũ tàng hình của Annabeth.

en: “The sword is celestial bronze. Forged by the Cyclopes, tempered in the heart of Mount Etna, cooled in the River Lethe. It’s deadly to monsters, to any creature from the Underworld, provided they don’t kill you first. But the blade will pass through mortals like an illusion. They simply are not important enough for the blade to kill. And I should warn you: as a demigod, you can be killed by either celestial or normal weapons. You are twice as vulnerable.”
en_results: "title": "Percy Jackson and the Olympians: The Lightning Thief", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi: - Đây là kiếm thần. Sản phẩm từ chính tay người Cyclopes, được tôi trong lòng núi Etna rồi nhúng xuống sông Lethe. Với nó, cháu có thể giết được quái vật hay bất kỳ cơ thể sống nào dưới địa ngục, miễn là chúng chưa kịp ra tay trước. Nhưng lưỡi kiếm chỉ lướt qua cơ thể người phàm như ảo ảnh. Lý do đơn giản là người phàm quá chất phác nên thanh kiếm không giết. Ta nhắc cháu nhớ một điều: Vì là á thần nên cả vũ khí nhà trời lẫn phàm trần đều lấy mạng cháu được. Cho nên cháu phải cẩn thận gấp đôi.
tr: "Kılıç ilahi bronzdan yapılma. Kikloplar dövdü bu kılıcı, Etna Dağı'nın tam göbeğinde su verildi, Lethe Irmağı'nda soğutuldu. Canavarlara, Yeraltı Dünyası'nın tüm yaratıklarına karşı ölümcül; tabii, onlar seni daha önce öldürmezlerse. Ama ölümlülere değdi mi bir hayalet gibi geçer gider içlerinden. Kılıcın gücüne kıyasla ölümlülerin önemi yok. Seni uyarayım: bir yarı-tanrı olduğun için hem ilahi hem de normal silahlar sana işliyor. İki kat savunmasızsın.
tr_results: "title": "Percy Jackson ve Olimpos Tanriları - Şimşek Gökova", "author": "Rick Riordan"
es: —La espada está hecha de bronce celestial. Forjado por los cíclopes, templado en el corazón del monte Etna y enfriado en las aguas del río Lete. Es letal para los monstruos y para cualquier criatura del inframundo, siempre y cuando no te maten primero, claro. Sin embargo, a los mortales los atraviesa como una ilusión; sencillamente, no son lo bastante importantes para que la espada los mate. ¡Ah!, y he de advertirte otra cosa: como semidiós, puedes perecer tanto bajo armas celestiales como normales. Eres doblemente vulnerable.
es_results: "title": "Percy Jackson y los dioses del Olimpo: El ladrón del rayo", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi_translation: - This is the divine sword. A product made by the hands of the Cyclopes, forged in the heart of Mount Etna and then quenched in the River Lethe. With it, you can kill monsters or any living being in the underworld, as long as they haven't struck first. But the blade will just pass through mortal bodies like an illusion. The simple reason is that mortals are too innocent for the sword to kill. I remind you of one thing: Because you are a demigod, both celestial and mortal weapons can take your life. So you must be doubly careful.
tr_translation: "The sword is made of divine bronze. The Cyclopes forged this sword, it was tempered in the heart of Mount Etna, cooled in the River Lethe. Deadly to monsters, to all creatures of the Underworld; of course, if they don't kill you first. But when it touches mortals, it passes through them like a ghost. Compared to the power of the sword, mortals are insignificant. Let me warn you: since you are a demigod, both divine and normal weapons affect you. You are twice as vulnerable."
es_translation: —The sword is made of celestial bronze. Forged by the Cyclopes, tempered in the heart of Mount Etna, and cooled in the waters of the River Lethe. It is lethal to monsters and any creature of the underworld, as long as they don't kill you first, of course. However, it passes through mortals like an illusion; they simply aren't important enough for the sword to kill them. Ah!, and I must warn you of one more thing: as a demigod, you can perish by both celestial and normal weapons. You are doubly vulnerable.
st: "Sabole ke boronse ea leholimo. E entsoe ke cyclopes, e nang le pelo ea Thaba ea Etna, e pholile nōkeng ea Lethe. Ho bolaea litonanahali, ho sebopuoa leha e le sefe se tsoang Underworld, ha feela li sa u bolaea pele. Empa lehare le tla feta ho batho ba shoang joalo ka illusion. Ha li na thuso feela ka ho lekaneng hore li bolaee. 'Me ke lokela ho u lemosa: e le demigod, u ka bolaoa ke libetsa tsa leholimo kapa tse tloaelehileng. Kahoo ka nako e 'ngoe u tla be u le tlokotsing habeli. "
yo: "Idà náà jẹ́ idẹ ọ̀run. Àwọn Cyclopes dá a sílẹ̀, tí wọ́n bínú ní àárín òkè Etna, tútù nínú Odò Lethe. Ó pa àwọn ẹranko, sí ẹ̀dá èyíkéyìí láti Underworld, níwọ̀n ìgbà tí wọn kò bá kọ́kọ́ pa ọ́. Ṣùgbọ́n abẹ náà yóò kọjá nípasẹ̀ àwọn ènìyàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀tànjẹ. Wọn kò ṣe pàtàkì tó fún abẹ́ láti pa. Àti pé ó yẹ kí n kìlọ̀ fún ọ: gẹ́gẹ́ bí demigod, àwọn ohun ìjà ọ̀run tàbí àwọn ohun ìjà ọ̀run lè pa ọ́. O jẹ́ aláìlera lẹ́ẹ̀mejì."
tn: 'The sword is celestial bronze' - Lerumo le ne le na le borokwa jo bo kwa legodimong O ne a le mo tseleng e e neng e le mo gare ga thaba ya Etna, e e neng e le mo nokeng ya Lethe. E a bo e le motho yo o ka tswang mo lefatsheng le le mo lefatsheng, fa e le gore ga ba go bolaye pele. Le fa go ntse jalo, le fa go ntse jalo, go tla feta batho ba ba swang jaaka seitlhamo. Ga di botlhokwa fela ka gonne di ka se kgone go bolaya. Ka jalo, ke tla go lemosa gore o ka nna wa bo o le motho yo o sa kgoneng go bolawa ke dibetsa tsa legodimo kgotsa tse di tlwaelegileng. Gonne o tla nna gabedi mo kotsing."
ty: " E mea mure ore te 'o'e. Faaitoitohia e te mau Cyclopes, tamǎrûhia i ropu i te Mou'a Etna, tei toetoe i roto i te Anavai Lethe. E mea pohe roa no te mau animala taehae, no te tahi noa ' ' e mea ora no roto mai i te ao i raro i te fenua, mai te peu e eita ratou e haapohe na mua ia outou. E haere râ te tipi na roto i te mau taata tahuti mai te hoê mana'o hape. E ere te reira i te mea faufaa roa no te taparahi i te taata. E e ti'a ia'u ia faaara'tu ia outou: mai te hoê afa tara, e nehenehe outou e taparahi-pohe-hia e te mau mauhaa no te ra'i aore râ no te mau mea matauhia. E mea paruparu roa oe ".
mai: "तलवार खगोलीय कांस्य अछि। साइक्लोप्स द्वारा बनल, माउंट एटनाक बीचोबीच टेम्पर्ड, लेथे नदीमे ठंडा भऽ गेल। ई राक्षसक लेल, अंडरवर्ल्डक कोनो प्राणीक लेल घातक अछि, बशर्ते ओ अहाँकेँ पहिने नहि मारत। मुदा ब्लेड भ्रम जकाँ नश्वरसँ गुजरत। ब्लेडकेँ मारबाक लेल ई एतेक महत्वपूर्ण नहि अछि। आ हमरा अहाँकेँ चेतौनी देबाक चाही : एकटा देवताक रूपमे अहाँकेँ खगोलीय वा सामान्य हथियारसँ मारल जा सकैत अछि। अहां दुगुना कमजोर छी।
mg: "Varahina selestialy ny sabatra. Nangatsiatsiaka teo amin'ny Reniranon'i Lethe ny Cyclopes, izay nampangatsiatsiaka teo afovoan'ny Tendrombohitra Etna. Mahafaty ny biby goavam-be, ho an'ny zavaboary rehetra avy any amin'ny tontolo ambanin'ny tany, raha toa ka tsy mamono anao aloha izy ireo. Fa ny lela dia handalo amin'ny olombelona toy ny nofinofy. Tsy dia manan-danja loatra izy ireo mba hamonoana ny lela. Ary tokony hampitandrina anareo aho: amin'ny maha-andriamanitra anao, dia mety ho vonoina amin'ny alalan'ny fitaovam-piadiana selestialy na ara-dalàna ianao. Avo roa heny noho ny vatanao tena marefo ianao."

en: We careened out of the Lincoln Tunnel and back into the rainstorm, people and monsters tossed around the bus, cars plowed aside like bowling pins.
vi: Xe lao nhanh khỏi đường hầm, trở lại màn mưa tầm tã. Người và yêu quái bị quăng quật trong xe.
tr: Yan yatmış bir halde Lincoln Tüneli'nden çıktık ve tekrar yağmurlu fırtınaya daldık. Otobüste insanlar, canavarlar bir o yana, bir bu yana devriliyordu, çarptığımız arabalar bowling kukaları gibi sağa sola dağılıyordu.
tr_results: "title": "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy", "author": "Douglas Adams"
es: Salimos del túnel Lincoln a toda velocidad y volvimos a la tormenta, hombres y monstruos dando tumbos dentro del autobús, mientras los coches eran apartados o derribados como si fueran bolos.
vi_translation: The car sped out of the tunnel, back into the torrential rain. Humans and monsters were tossed around inside the car.
tr_translation: We emerged from the Lincoln Tunnel lying down and plunged back into the rainy storm. On the bus, people and monsters were toppling this way and that, and the cars we hit were scattering like bowling pins.
es_translation: We exited the Lincoln Tunnel at full speed and returned to the storm, men and monsters tumbling inside the bus, while cars were pushed aside or knocked over like bowling pins.
st: Re ile ra hlokomela ho tsoa Lincoln Tunnel 'me ra khutlela sefefong sa pula, batho le litonanahali ba akhotsoa ho potoloha bese, likoloi li ile tsa lema ka thōko joaloka pins bowling.
yo: A jáde kúrò nínú Lincoln Tunnel a sì padà sínú ìjì òjò, àwọn ènìyàn àti àwọn ẹranko tí wọ́n sọ yíká ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ náà, àwọn ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ kọjá sí ẹ̀gbẹ́ bíi bọ́ọ̀lù.

ty: Ua haere atura matou i rapae i te fare o Lincoln Tunnel e ua ho'i atura i roto i te ûa rahi, ua tauehaa te mau taata e te mau animala taehae na te hiti o te pereoo uta taata, e ua apapa noa te mau pereoo i te hiti mai te mau pine ra te huru.

en: Somehow the driver found an exit. We shot off the highway, through half a dozen traffic lights, and ended up barreling down one of those New Jersey rural roads where you can’t believe there’s so much nothing right across the river from New York. There were woods to our left, the Hudson River to our right, and the driver seemed to be veering toward the river.
vi: Xe hơi chạy dạt sang hai bên lề đường. Không hiểu bằng cách nào, bác tài tìm được đường thoát cho xe. Xe buýt lao vút trên xa lộ, vượt qua năm sáu ngã tư, cuối cùng lăn bánh trên đường đất vùng nông thôn New Jersey. Không ai tin ngay cạnh New York có loại đường vừa bé vừa lổn nhổn như vậy. Bên trái đường là rừng, bên phải là sông Hudson. Lúc này, hình như bác tài đang mất tay lái khiến xe gần lao xuống sông.
tr: Nasıl olduysa sürücü otobandan çıkışı buldu. Otobandan fırladık, yarım düzine trafik ışığı geçtik ve New Jersey'in kırsal bölgelerinden aşağı fıçı gibi yuvarlanmaya başladık. Ortalık o kadar ıssızdı ki, sanki New York'ta ırmağı geçtikten sonra hayat bitiyordu. Solumuzda korular, sağımızdaHudson Irmağı vardı ve sürücü ırmağı tercih etmiş gibiydi.
es: De algún modo, el conductor encontró una salida. Dejamos la autopista a todo trapo, cruzamos media docena de semáforos y acabamos, aún a velocidad de vértigo, en una de esas carreteras rurales de Nueva Jersey en las que es imposible creer que haya tanta nada justo al otro lado de Nueva York. Había un bosque a la izquierda y el río Hudson a la derecha, hacia donde el conductor parecía dirigirse.
vi_translation: The car swerved to the sides of the road. Somehow, the driver found a way to get the bus out. The bus sped along the highway, passed through five or six intersections, and finally rolled onto a dirt road in rural New Jersey. No one could believe that right next to New York there could be such small and bumpy roads. On the left side of the road is a forest, and on the right is the Hudson River. At this moment, it seems the driver is losing control of the steering wheel, causing the car to nearly plunge into the river.
tr_translation: Somehow, the driver found the exit off the highway. We shot off the highway, passed half a dozen traffic lights, and started rolling down like a barrel through the rural areas of New Jersey. The area was so desolate that it felt as if life ended after crossing the river in New York. There were groves to our left, the Hudson River to our right, and it seemed the driver preferred the river.
es_translation: Somehow, the driver found an exit. We left the highway at full speed, crossed half a dozen traffic lights, and ended up, still at breakneck speed, on one of those rural roads in New Jersey where it's impossible to believe there's so much nothingness just on the other side of New York. There was a forest to the left and the Hudson River to the right, towards which the driver seemed to be heading.
st: Ka tsela e itseng, mokhanni o ile a fumana ho tsoa. Re ile ra thunya tseleng e kholo, ka halofo ea leshome le metso e 'meli ea sephethe-phethe, 'me ra qetella re theohile e' ngoe ea litsela tseo tsa mahaeng tsa New Jersey moo u ke keng ua lumela hore ha ho na letho le lekaneng ka mose ho nōka e tsoang New York. Ho ne ho e-na le meru ka ho letšehali, Noka ea Hudson ka ho le letona, mme mokhanni o ne a bonahala a le haufi le nōka.
yo: Lọ́nàkọnà awakọ̀ náà rí ìjáde. A yìnbọn kúrò lójú ọ̀nà, nípasẹ̀ ìdajì iná ọkọ̀ méjìlá, a sì parí sí ìsàlẹ̀ ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ọ̀nà ìgbèríko New Jersey yẹn níbi tí o kò ti lè gbàgbọ́ pé kò sí ohun púpọ̀ ní òdìkejì odò láti New York. Igbó wà ní apá òsì wa, Odò Hudson ní apá ọ̀tún wa, awakọ̀ náà sì dàbí ẹni pé ó ń yí padà sí odò.
tn: Ka tsela nngwe mokgweetsi o ne a bona sengwe se se sa tswang teng. Re ne ra tsamaya ka tsela e e fetang halofo ya dipone tsa pharakano, mme re ne ra feleletsa re na le nngwe ya ditsela tsa metsesetoropo ya New Jersey kwa o ka se kgoneng go dumela gore ga go na sepe se se ka kgabaganyang noka go tswa kwa New York. Go ne go na le dikgong tse di neng di le kafa molemeng wa rona, Noka ya Hudson e ne e le kafa mojeng wa rona, mme mokgweetsi o ne a lebega a lebile kwa nokeng.
ty: Ua itea mai i te taata faahoro i te hoê uputa. Ua pupuhi matou i nia i te purumu rahi, na roto i te afa tatini mori pereoo, e i te pae hopea, ua pou matou i nia i te hoê o taua mau purumu ra i te mataeinaa no New Jersey i reira eita outou e nehenehe e tiaturi e aita hoê a'e mea i te tahi atu pae o te anavai mai New York mai. Te vai ra te mau uru raau i to matou pae aui, te Anavai Hudson i to matou pae atau, e mai te mea ra e, te hee ra te taata faahoro i te anavai.
mai: कोनो तरहेँ ड्राइवर बाहर निकलि गेल। हम आधा दर्जन ट्रैफिक लाइटक माध्यमसँ राजमार्गकेँ बंद कऽ देलौं आ अन्तमे न्यू जर्सीक ओहि ग्रामीण सड़कसभमेसँ एकटामे बैरल कऽ देलौं जतय अहाँकेँ विश्वास नहि भऽ रहल अछि जे न्यूयॉर्कसँ नदीक पार एतेक किछु नहि अछि। हमर बायां दिस जंगल छल, दहिना दिस हडसन नदी छल, आ ड्राइवर नदी दिस घुमैत बुझाइत छल।
mg: Na izany aza, nahita fivoahana ilay mpamily. en: “We got separated from our caravan,” I said. “Our circus caravan. The ringmaster told us to meet him at the gas station if we got lost, but he may have forgotten, or maybe he meant a different gas station. Anyway, we’re lost. Is that food I smell?”

es: —Nos separamos de la caravana —contesté—. Nuestra caravana del circo. El director de pista nos dijo que nos encontraríamos en la gasolinera si nos perdíamos, pero puede que se haya olvidado, o a lo mejor se refería a otra gasolinera. En cualquier caso, nos hemos perdido. ¿Eso que huelo es comida?
vi_translation: - We separated from the group. We work for the circus. Our uncle told us that if we got lost, we should come to this gas station, and he would wait for us. But he probably forgot, or he mentioned a different gas station, and we misunderstood. No matter what he said, we are lost now. Is that the smell of food?
tr_translation: "We got separated from our caravan," I said. "Our circus caravan. The circus manager had told us to wait at the gas station if we got lost, but either he forgot or he meant a different gas station. Anyway, we got lost. Is that the smell of food I'm sensing?"

en: Very, very carefully, without looking down, she knelt and draped the monster’s head in black cloth, then picked it up. It was still dripping green juice.
vi: Cực kỳ cẩn trọng, mắt vẫn không nhìn xuống, nó gói đầu yêu quái bằng miếng vải đen rồi nhặt lên. Thứ chất nhờn xanh lè vẫn nhỏ giọt từ thủ cấp.
tr: Çok, hem de çok dikkat ederek, aşağıya bakmadan diz çöktü ve canavarın kafasını kara kumaşa sardı, sonra yerden aldı. Kafadan hâlâ yeşil sıvılar damlıyordu.
es: Con mucho cuidado, sin mirar abajo ni un instante, se arrodilló, envolvió la cabeza del monstruo en el paño negro y la recogió. Aún chorreaba un líquido verdoso.
vi_translation: Extremely cautious, without looking down, it wrapped the demon's head in a black cloth and picked it up. The green slime still dripped from the head.
tr_translation: Very, very carefully, without looking down, he knelt and wrapped the monster's head in black cloth, then picked it up from the ground. Green fluids were still dripping from the head.
es_translation: Very carefully, without looking down for even a moment, he knelt, wrapped the monster's head in the black cloth, and picked it up. It was still dripping a greenish liquid.

en: We found some old plastic grocery bags behind the snack counter and double-wrapped Medusa’s head. We plopped it on the table where we’d eaten dinner and sat around it, too exhausted to speak.
en_results: "title": "The Perks of Being a Wallflower", "author": "Stephen Chbosky"
vi: Tìm được mấy bịch nhựa, loại hay đựng thực phẩm, đã cũ tôi bọc kín đầu Medusa. Quẳng bọc giấy xuống bàn lúc nãy cả ba còn ngồi mê mải ăn, chúng tôi kéo ghế ngồi, mệt đến độ nói không ra hơi.
tr: Büfe tezgahının arkasında eski plastik torbalardan bulduk ve Medusa'nın kafasını bunlarla iki kez sardık. Yemek yediğimiz masaya küt diye kafayı fırlattık ve etrafına kurulduk. Konuşamayacak kadar yorgunduk.
es: Encontramos unas bolsas de plástico detrás del mostrador y envolvimos varias veces la cabeza de Medusa. La colocamos encima de la mesa en que habíamos cenado y nos sentamos alrededor, demasiado cansados para hablar.
vi_translation: Found some plastic bags, the kind often used for food, I tightly wrapped Medusa's head. Throwing the paper bundle down on the table where all three of us had been engrossed in eating earlier, we pulled up chairs and sat down, too tired to speak.
tr_translation: We found old plastic bags behind the buffet counter and wrapped Medusa's head with them twice. We threw the head onto the table where we were eating with a thud and gathered around it. We were too tired to speak.
es_translation: We found some plastic bags behind the counter and wrapped Medusa's head several times. We placed it on the table where we had dined and sat around, too tired to talk.
st: Re ile ra fumana mekotla ea khale ea polasetiki ea polasetiki e ka morao ho seneke counter le hlooho ea Medusa e phuthetsoeng habeli. Re e kentse tafoleng eo re neng re e ja lijo tsa mantsiboea 'me re lula re e potile, re khathetse haholo ho bua.
yo: A rí àwọn àpò oúnjẹ ṣiṣu àtijọ́ lẹ́yìn ẹ̀rọ ìpanu àti orí Medusa tí wọ́n dì lẹ́ẹ̀mejì. A gbé e sórí tábìlì níbi tí a ti jẹ oúnjẹ alẹ́ a sì jókòó yí i ká, ó ti rẹ̀ wá jù láti sọ̀rọ̀.
tn: Re ne ra fitlhela di-plastiki tsa bogologolo tse di neng di le kwa morago ga di-snack counter counter le tlhogo ya Medusa e e phuthetsweng gabedi. Re ne ra e baya mo tafoleng e re neng re e ja e bile re ne re e ja, e bile re ne re lapile thata go e bua.

en: We camped out in the woods, a hundred yards from the main road, in a marshy clearing that local kids had obviously been using for parties. The ground was littered with flattened soda cans and fast-food wrappers.
en_results: "title": "The Perks of Being a Wallflower", "author": "Stephen Chbosky"
vi: Chúng tôi ngủ trong rừng, cách đường chính chừng ba mươi mét, tại một bãi đất trống lầy lội. Thoạt nhìn, ta biết ngay bọn trẻ quanh vùng hay đàn đúm ở đây: mặt đất đầy vỏ lon nước ngọt bẹp dúm và giấy gói đồ ăn nhanh.
vi_results: "title": "The Diary of a Young Girl", "author": "Anne Frank"
tr: Ana yolun 80-90 metre kadar ötesinde, ormanlık alanın bataklık bölgesinde kamp yapıyorduk. O civarda yaşayan gençlerin buralarda sık sık parti verdiği belliydi. Yerler, üzerlerine basılmaktan artık düzleşmiş içecek kutuları ve fast-food ambalajlarıyla kaplıydı.
tr_results: "title": "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy", "author": "Douglas Adams"
es: Acampamos en el bosque, a unos cien metros de la carretera principal, en un claro que los chicos de la zona al parecer utilizaban para sus fiestas. El suelo estaba lleno de latas aplastadas, envoltorios de comida rápida y otros desechos.
vi_translation: We slept in the forest, about thirty meters from the main road, in a muddy clearing. At first glance, one could immediately tell that local kids often hung out here: the ground was littered with flattened soda cans and fast food wrappers.
tr_translation: We were camping about 80-90 meters beyond the main road, in the swampy area of the forest. It was clear that the young people living around here often threw parties in these places. The ground was covered with drink cans and fast-food wrappers that had been flattened from being stepped on.
es_translation: We camped in the forest, about a hundred meters from the main road, in a clearing that the local kids apparently used for their parties. The ground was littered with crushed cans, fast food wrappers, and other trash.
st: Re ile ra ea morung, li-yards tse lekholo ho tloha tseleng e kholo, ka ho hlaka hore bana ba moo ba ne ba sebelisa meketjana. Mobu o ile oa tšeloa ka makhetho a soda a phanyehileng le li-wrappeers tse potlakileng.
yo: A pàgọ́ jáde nínú igbó, ọgọ́rùn-ún yàrá sí ọ̀nà ńlá, nínú ìparun tí ó hàn gbangba pé àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ ti ń lò fún ayẹyẹ. Ilẹ̀ náà kún fún àwọn agolo ọtí líle tí wọ́n fẹ́lẹ́ àti àwọn ìdì oúnjẹ kíákíá.
tn: Re ne ra isiwa kwa sekgweng, go ne go na le dimitara di le 100 go tswa mo tseleng e kgolo, ka go lemoga gore bana ba mo gae ba ne ba dirisa mekgatlho. Mobu o ne o tletse ka makgwakgwa a soso le di-soup tse di nang le dijo tse di bonako.
ty: Ua puhapa matou i roto i te uru raau, hoê hanere metera i te atea i te purumu rahi, i roto i te hoê vahi vari e ua faaohipa te mau tamarii no taua vahi ra i te mau arearearaa. Ua î roa te repo i te mau punu taepu e te mau puohu maa.

en: A shimmering image hovered over the void: my mother, frozen at the moment she’d dissolved in a shower of gold. Her face was distorted with pain, as if the Minotaur were still squeezing her neck. Her eyes looked directly at me, pleading: Go!
vi: Một hình bóng mờ ảo bay lơ lửng giữa lòng vực trống trải: mẹ tôi đứng sững trong tư thế lúc bị biến thành cơn mưa vàng. Mặt mẹ nhăn nhó vì đau như thể quỷ đầu bò vẫn còn siết cổ mẹ. Mắt mẹ nhìn tôi như van lơn: “Chạy đi con!”.
tr: Boşluğun üzerinde pırıl pırıl parlayan bir görüntü belirdi. Annem, bir altın yağmuru altında, kaskatı kesilmiş vaziyette oracıkta duruyordu. Minotorlar onu boğazlıyormuş gibi yüzü acıyla bükülmüştü. Gözleri bana kilitlenmişti, sanki Git! dercesine yalvarıyordu.
es: Se formaba una imagen sobre el abismo: mi madre, congelada en el momento en que se había disuelto en aquel resplandor dorado. Tenía el rostro desencajado por el dolor, como si el Minotauro siguiera retorciéndole el cuello. Me miraba fijamente y sus ojos suplicaban «¡Márchate!».
vi_translation: A vague silhouette floated in the empty chasm: my mother stood frozen in the posture she was in when she was turned into a golden rain. My mother's face was contorted with pain as if the bull-headed demon was still strangling her. My mother's eyes looked at me pleadingly: "Run, my child!".
tr_translation: A bright, shimmering image appeared over the void. My mother stood there, frozen stiff, under a shower of gold. His face was contorted with pain as if minotaurs were strangling him. His eyes were locked onto mine, pleading as if to say Go!
es_translation: An image was forming over the abyss: my mother, frozen in the moment she had dissolved into that golden glow. Her face was contorted with pain, as if the Minotaur were still twisting her neck. She stared at me intently, and her eyes pleaded "Leave!"
st: Hoʻoponopono ʻia ka hoʻoponopono ʻana i ka hoʻouluʻana i ka hoʻouluʻana i ka hoʻoponopono ʻana i ka hoʻoponopono. Sefahleho sa hae se ne se sothehile ka bohloko, eka Minotaur o ne a ntse a petsoha molaleng oa hae. Mahlo a hae a ncheba ka ho toba ho 'na, a kōpa, a re: "E-ea!
yo: Àwòrán tí ó ń tàn wà lórí àlàfo náà: ìyá mi, tí ó di dídì lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí ó ti tú nínú ìwẹ̀ wúrà. Ojú rẹ̀ yí padà pẹ̀lú ìrora, bí ẹni pé Minotaur ṣì ń tẹ ọrùn rẹ̀. Ojú rẹ̀ wò mí tààrà, ó bẹ̀bẹ̀ pé: Lọ!
tn: 'Mmaagwê o ne a tlhôla fa a ne a le mo tlhôla' - My mother was cold in the moment she was in a shower of gold Sefatlhego sa gagwe se ne se le botlhoko, jaaka e kete Setsuko se ne se sa ntse se mo tshamekêla. O ne a tlhôma matlho a me ka tlhamalalo, a re: Tsamaya!
ty: Ua ou'a a'era te hoê hoho'a i nia i te aore: to ' u metua vahine, ua toetoe roa oia i te taime a topa ' i oia i roto i te hoê haapueraa auro. Ua î roa to ' na hoho'a mata i te mauiui, mai te huru ra e te taamu noa ra te Minotaur i to ' na arapoa. Ua hi'o ti'a maira to'na mata i ni'a ia'u, ma te taparu e : A haere !
mai: एकटा झिलमिलाइत छवि शून्य पर मंडराइत छल: हमर माँ, ओहि क्षण जमल छलीह जखन ओ सोनाक बौछारमे घुलि गेल छलीह। दर्दसँ ओकर चेहरा विकृत भऽ गेल छल, जेना मिनोतौर एखनो ओकर गर्दन निचोड़ि रहल हो। ओकर आंखि सीधा हमरा दिस देखलक, विनती करैत छल: जाउ!

en: I tried to keep a low profile because my name and picture were splattered over the front pages of several East Coast newspapers. The Trenton Register-News showed a photo taken by a tourist as I got off the Greyhound bus. I had a wild look in my eyes. My sword was a metallic blur in my hands. It might’ve been a baseball bat or a lacrosse stick.
vi: Tôi cố gắng ẩn mình, càng ít người thấy càng tốt vì ảnh tôi theo nhiều tờ báo đi khắp miền duyên hải phía đông. Tờ Trenton Register News đăng tấm hình khách du lịch chụp tôi vừa chạy từ xe buýt Greyhound. Tôi không tin ở mắt mình: bóng thanh kiếm Thủy triều mờ mờ, trông như tôi đang cầm gậy vụt bóng chày.
vi_results: "title": "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao", "author": "Junot Diaz"
tr: Pek ortalıkta dolaşmıyordum çünkü birkaç Doğu Yakası gazetesinin kapaklarını ismim ve yüzüm süslüyordu. Trenton Register-News gazetesinde, Greyhound otobüsünden inerken bir turistin çektiği bir fotoğrafım yayınlanmıştı. Fotoğrafta, gözlerimde tuhaf bir ifade vardı. Elimde tuttuğum kılıcım, metalik mavi renk gözüküyordu. Elimdeki kılıç değil de pek ala bir beyzbol veya başka bir oyun sopası da olabilirdi.
tr_results: "title": "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao", "author": "Junot Diaz"
es: Intenté pasar inadvertido porque mi nombre y mi foto aparecían en varios periódicos de la costa Este. El Trenton Register—News mostraba la fotografía que me hizo un turista al bajar del autobús Greyhound. Tenía la mirada ida. La espada era un borrón metálico en mis manos. Habría podido ser un bate de béisbol o un palo de lacrosse.
vi_translation: I tried to hide myself, the fewer people saw me, the better, because my photos were being circulated by many newspapers throughout the eastern coastal region. The Trenton Register News published a picture taken by a tourist of me just as I was running from a Greyhound bus. I couldn't believe my eyes: the shadow of the Tide sword was faintly visible, making it look like I was holding a baseball bat.
tr_translation: I wasn't out and about much because my name and face were gracing the covers of a few East Coast newspapers. A photo of me taken by a tourist while I was getting off a Greyhound bus had been published in the Trenton Register-News. In the photo, there was a strange expression in my eyes. The sword I was holding appeared metallic blue. What I was holding could very well have been a baseball bat or some other kind of game bat instead of a sword.
es_translation: I tried to go unnoticed because my name and photo appeared in several newspapers on the East Coast. The Trenton Register-News showed the photograph a tourist took of me as I got off the Greyhound bus. I had a vacant look in my eyes. The sword was a metallic blur in my hands. It could have been a baseball bat or a lacrosse stick.
st: Ke lekile ho boloka boemo bo tlase hobane lebitso la ka le setšoantšo li ne li le splattered holim'a maqephe a ka pele a likoranta tse 'maloa tsa East Coast. Trenton Register-News e bontšitse setšoantšo se nkiloeng ke mohahlauli ha ke ntse ke theoha bese ea Greyhound. Ke ne ke e-na le ponahalo e ntle mahlong a ka. Sabole ea ka e ne e le seruruho sa tšepe matsohong a ka. E ka 'na ea e-ba bolo ea maoto kapa thupa ea lacrosse.
yo: Mo gbìyànjú láti jẹ́ kí àkọsílẹ̀ kékeré wà nítorí orúkọ àti àwòrán mi ni wọ́n fọ́ lórí ojú ìwé iwájú ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìwé ìròyìn East Coast. Trenton Register-News fi àwòrán kan hàn tí arìnrìn-àjò afẹ́ ya bí mo ṣe bọ́ nínú ọkọ̀ Greyhound. Mo ní ìwò tó burú ní ojú mi. Idà mi jẹ́ ohun èlò irin ní ọwọ́ mi. Ó lè jẹ́ bọ́ọ̀lù bọ́ọ̀lù aláfẹsẹ̀gbá tàbí ọ̀pá lacrosse.

en: She had beady eyes; pointy, coffee-stained teeth; a floppy denim hat, and a denim dress that bulged so much, she looked like a blue-jean blimp.
vi: Mắt bà ta tròn xoe, răng nhọn và đen như nghiện cà phê. Bà này đội mũ vải jeans, mặc váy may cùng chất liệu chật cứng, ngấn thịt nổi từng cuộn khiến bà ta trông giống quả khinh khí cầu bọc vải.
tr: Kadının pörtlek gözleri; sivri, kahve lekeli dişleri; gevşek duran, kot benzeri bir kumaştan yapılmış bir şapkası ve yine aynı kumaştan yapılmış çuval gibi bir elbisesi vardı. Bu elbişeyle kottan yapılmış bir balon gibi gözüküyordu.
es: Tenía ojos negros y brillantes; dientes puntiagudos y manchados de café; llevaba un sombrero tejano de ala flácida, y un vestido que le sacaba tantos michelines que parecía un zepelín vaquero.
es_results: "title": "Don Quixote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra"
vi_translation: Her eyes were wide open, her teeth sharp and black as if addicted to coffee. She wore a jeans fabric hat, a tightly fitting dress made of the same material, with rolls of flesh bulging out, making her look like a fabric-covered hot air balloon.
tr_translation: The woman had bulging eyes; sharp, coffee-stained teeth; a loosely fitting hat made of a denim-like fabric, and a sack-like dress made of the same fabric. She looked like a balloon made of denim in this outfit.
es_translation: She had black, shiny eyes; sharp, coffee-stained teeth; wore a floppy-brimmed cowboy hat, and a dress that squeezed out so many rolls of fat that she looked like a cowboy zeppelin.

en: My whole leg was on fire. I tried to jab Riptide into the Chimera’s mouth, but the serpent tail wrapped around my ankles and pulled me off balance, and my blade flew out of my hand, spinning out of the hole in the Arch and down toward the Mississippi River.
en_results: "title": "Percy Jackson and the Olympians: The Lightning Thief", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi: Toàn thân tôi như có lửa thiêu. Tôi cố đâm mũi kiếm vào miệng Chimera nhưng bị đuôi rắn quấn quanh cổ chân, lôi tôi ngã nhào. Kiếm tuột khỏi tay văng đến lỗ thủng khi nãy và rơi xuống dòng Mississippi.
tr: Tüm bacağım ateş gibi yanıyordu. Dalgakıran'ı, Kimera'nın ağzına tıkmaya çalıştım ama sürüngen kuyruğu, bacaklarıma dolanıp, dengemi alt üst etti. Bu sırada, kılıcım elimden fırlayarak Kemer'deki boşluktan aşağı düştü ve Mississippi Nehri'nin akınüsma kapılarak gözden kayboldu.
es: Sentí la pierna entera arder. Intenté clavarle la espada en la boca, pero la cola se revolvió y me hizo trastabillar. La espada se me escurrió entre las manos y cayó por el boquete a las aguas del Mississipi.
vi_translation: My whole body felt like it was on fire. I tried to thrust my sword into the Chimera's mouth, but the snake's tail coiled around my ankle and pulled me down. The sword slipped from my hand, flew to the hole from earlier, and fell into the Mississippi River.
tr_translation: My entire leg was burning like fire. I tried to shove the Breakwater into the Chimera's mouth, but its serpentine tail coiled around my legs, throwing me off balance. At that moment, my sword flew out of my hand and fell through the gap in the Kemer, disappearing into the Mississippi River's current.
es_translation: I felt my entire leg burning. I tried to stab it in the mouth with my sword, but its tail lashed out and made me stumble. The sword slipped from my hands and fell through the hole into the waters of the Mississippi.
st: Leoto la ka kaofela le ne le tuka. Ke lekile Jab Riptide ka molomong oa Chimera, empa mohatla oa noha o phuthetsoe ho potoloha maqaqailana a ka mme oa ntsamaisa ho leka-lekana, mme lehare la ka la fofa letsohong la ka, la tsoa ka sekoting se ka har'a Arch le tlase ho ea nokeng ea Mississippi.
yo: Gbogbo ẹsẹ̀ mi ló ń jóná. Mo gbìyànjú láti gbé Riptide sí ẹnu Chimera, ṣùgbọ́n ìrù ejò náà dì yí ẹsẹ̀ mi ká ó sì fà mí kúrò ní ìwọ̀ntúnwọ̀nsì, abẹ́ mi sì fò jáde kúrò lọ́wọ́ mi, tí ó ń yí jáde kúrò nínú ihò ní Arch àti sọ̀kalẹ̀ sí Odò Mississippi.
tn: 'Leoto la me le ne le tuka ka lôtlô' - My leg was on fire Ke ne ka leka Jab Riptide mo molomong wa Chimera, mme mogatla wa noga o ne o phuthegile mo maatleng a me, mme mogatla wa me o ne wa nkopanya mo seatleng sa me, wa tswa mo seatleng sa me go tswa mo leganong le kwa tlase go ya kwa nokeng ya Mississippi.
ty: Ua paapaa roa to ' u avae taatoa. Ua tamata vau i te patia i te popo i roto i te vaha o te Chimera, tera râ, ua taamuhia te aero ophi i ni'a i to'u manimani avae e ua huti mai ia'u mai ni'a mai i to'u rima, e ua pee maira ta'u tipi i rapae i to'u rima, ma te ou'a i rapae i te apoo i roto i te apou e tae roa'tu i te anavai no Mississipi.
mai: हमर पूरा टांग मे आगि लागि गेल छल। हम रिप्टाइडकेँ चिमेराक मुँहमे घुसयबाक प्रयास कयलहुँ, मुदा नागक पूँछ हमर टखनाक चारू कात लपेटि हमरा सन्तुलनसँ खींचि लेलक, आ हमर ब्लेड हमर हाथसँ उड़ि गेल, आर्कक छेदसँ बाहर निकलि मिसिसिपी नदीक दिस चलि गेल।

en: I’d love to tell you I had some deep revelation on my way down, that I came to terms with my own mortality, laughed in the face of death, et cetera.
vi: Tôi thích tự nhận rằng khi cắm đầu lao xuống, tôi ngộ ra chân lý cuộc đời, rằng cái chết không còn đáng sợ v. v.. và v. v...
tr: Nehre doğru düşerken derin bir farkındalığa eriştiğimi, ölümlü halimle barışık olduğumu, ölümle dalga geçtiğimi ve buna benzer bir sürü şey daha söylemek isterdim sizlere.
es: Me encantaría contarte que tuve una profunda revelación durante mi caída, que acepté mi propia mortalidad, que me reí en la cara de la muerte, etcétera.
es_results: "title": "One Hundred Years of Solitude", "author": "Gabriel Garcia Marquez"
vi_translation: I like to claim that when I plunge headfirst, I realize the truth of life, that death is no longer frightening, etc., etc...
tr_translation: I would like to tell you that as I was falling towards the river, I reached a deep awareness, that I was at peace with my mortal self, that I was mocking death, and many other similar things.
es_translation: I would love to tell you that I had a profound revelation during my fall, that I accepted my own mortality, that I laughed in the face of death, etcetera.

en: At that point, I realized a few things: first, I had not been flattened into a pancake. I had not been barbecued. I couldn’t even feel the Chimera poison boiling in my veins anymore. I was alive, which was good.
en_results: "title": "Percy Jackson and the Olympians: The Lightning Thief", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi: Lúc ấy, tôi nhận ra vài điều. Thứ nhất: Người tôi không dẹp lép như bánh xếp. May mà trước khi nhảy, tôi chưa thành thịt nướng. Nọc độc của Chimera không còn sục sôi trong mạch máu nữa. Tôi còn sống, thế là tốt rồi.
tr: Bu noktada birkaç şey fark ettim. İlk olarak, bir krep gibi dümdüz olmamıştım. Kimse beni barbekü yapmamıştı. Hatta, artık damarlarımda Kimera'nın zehrini bile hissetmiyordum. Hayattaydım ki, bu da iyi bir şeydi.
es: En ese punto reparé en unas cuantas cosas: primero, no me había convertido en una tortita al estrellarme; segundo, no me habían asado a la parrilla; y, tercero, ni siquiera sentía ya el veneno de Quimera en las venas. Simplemente estaba vivo, y era genial.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y la Piedra Filosofal", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: At that moment, I realized a few things. First: My body is not flattened like a dumpling. Luckily, before jumping, I hadn't turned into grilled meat. The Chimera's venom no longer boils in my veins. I'm still alive, that's good.
tr_translation: At this point, I realized a few things. First of all, I hadn't been flattened like a pancake. No one had barbecued me. In fact, I no longer even felt the venom of Chimera in my veins. I was alive, which was a good thing.
es_translation: At that point, I noticed a few things: first, I hadn't turned into a pancake upon crashing; second, I hadn't been grilled; and third, I no longer even felt the Chimera's venom in my veins. I was simply alive, and it was great.
st: Ka nako eo, ke ile ka hlokomela lintho tse 'maloa: pele, ke ne ke sa ka ka flattened ka pancake. Ha kea ka ka barbecued. Ke ne ke sa khone le ho ikutloa eka makhasi a makhasi a ka a makhasi. Ke ne ke phela, ke ne ke phela hantle.
yo: Ní àkókò yẹn, mo rí àwọn nkan díẹ̀: ní àkọ́kọ́, wọn kò tí ì fọ́ mi sínú pankéèkì. Wọn kò tí ì dáná fún mi. Mi ò tilẹ̀ lè ní ìmọ̀lára májèlé Chimera náà tí ó ń gbóná nínú iṣan mi mọ́. Mo wà láàyè, èyí tí ó dára.
tn: Ka nako eo, ke ne ka lemoga dilo di le mmalwa: pele, ga ke a ka ka bo ke le mo gare ga panana. Ga ke a ka ka bo ke le mo go rileng. Ke ne ke sa tlhole ke kgona go lemoga gore go na le botlhole jo bo sa tlholeng bo le mo teng ga me. Ke ne ke na le botshelo jo bo siameng, ke ne ke tshela.

en: No response. Just the dark drift of garbage downriver, the enormous catfish gliding by, the flash of sunset on the water’s surface far above, turning everything the color of butterscotch.
vi: Không lời đáp. Xung quanh chỉ có rác nối nhau trôi theo dòng, một con cá da trơn to khổng tượng lướt qua và ánh nắng lúc hoàng hôn tít trên cao xuyên qua làn nước chở nặng phù sa biến tất cả thành màu kẹo bơ caremen.
vi_results: "title": "The Old Man and the Sea", "author": "Ernest Hemingway"
tr: Yanıt gelmedi. Duyduğum tek şey, nehirden aşağı doğrusürüklenen çöpler, devasa bir kedi balığının süzülüşü, ta yukarılarda gün batımının suyun yüzeyine vuruşu ve her şeyi karamela rengine döndürmesiydi.
tr_results: "title": "The Old Man and the Sea", "author": "Ernest Hemingway"
es: No hubo respuesta. Sólo la oscura corriente de basura, el enorme siluro siguiendo su rastro, el reflejo del atardecer en la superficie del agua, allá arriba, volviéndolo todo de color caramelo.
vi_translation: No response. All around, only trash floated along the current, a giant catfish glided by, and the sunlight at sunset high above pierced through the silt-laden water, turning everything into a caramel candy color.
tr_translation: No response came. The only thing I heard was the trash drifting down the river, the glide of a massive catfish, the sunset hitting the water's surface way up high and turning everything into a caramel color.
es_translation: There was no response. Only the dark current of garbage, the enormous catfish following its trail, the reflection of the sunset on the surface of the water, up above, turning everything the color of caramel.
st: Ha ho karabo. Feela ho fifala ha lithōle downriver, e kholo catfish gliding ke, ho khanya ha letsatsi le likela holim'a metsi a ka holimo, ho retelehela ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe mmala oa butterscotch.
yo: Kò sí èsì. Ìrìn dúdú ìdọ̀tí ìsàlẹ̀ odò, ẹja ológbò ńlá náà ń fò kọjá, ìmọ́lẹ̀ ìwọ̀ oòrùn lórí ojú omi jìnnà sí òkè, tí ó ń yí gbogbo nkan padà ní àwọ̀ butterscotch.
tn: Ga go na karabo. Fela fa e le go fudusiwa ga matlakala a a kwa tlase, tlhapi e kgolo ya katse e e fudugetseng, go phatsima ga letsatsi mo bogodimong jwa metsi a a kwa godimo, go fetola mmala mongwe le mongwe wa butterscotch.
ty: Aita e pahonoraa. Na roto noa i te heeraa pouri o te mau pehu i raro i te fenua, te mimi rahi e hahaere noa ra, te anaana o te toparaa mahana i nia ' ' e i te pape, ma te huri i te mau mea atoa i nia i te peni o te pata.
mai: कोनो प्रतिक्रिया नहि. बस कचराक नीचाँ गहिर बहाव, विशाल कैटफिश ग्लाइडिंग, पानिक सतह पर सूर्यास्तक चमक बहुत ऊपर जे सब किछु बटरस्कॉचक रंग बदलि दैत अछि।
mg: Tsy misy valiny. Ny fikisahan'ny fako any ambany fotsiny, ny trondro goavana mitsongoloka, ny tara-masoandro miposaka eo amin'ny fanambonin'ny rano any ambony any, ka mamadika ny zava-drehetra ho lokon'ny dibera.

en: A news lady was talking for the camera: “Probably not a terrorist attack, we’re told, but it’s still very early in the investigation. The damage, as you can see, is very serious. We’re trying to get to some of the survivors, to question them about eyewitness reports of someone falling from the Arch.”
vi: Có nữ phóng viên nói trước ống kính: - Theo chúng tôi được biết, đây có lẽ không phải là một vụ khủng bố. Tuy nhiên, các nhà chức trách mới trong giai đoạn đầu của cuộc điều tra. Như quý vị thấy, tổn hại là rất nghiêm trọng. Chúng tôi đang cố gắng tiếp cận nhóm người sống sót. Họ chứng kiến tận mắt có người ngã từ đỉnh Gateway Arch.
tr: Bir spiker kameraların karşısında konuşuyordu. "Bize söylendiğine göre, bu büyük bir ihtimalle bir terörist saldırısı değil ama henüz kapsamlı bir araştırma yapılmadı. Gördüğünüz gibi, hasar çok büyük. Kemer'den düşen biriyle ilgili bilgi almak için kurtulan görgü tanıklarını bulmaya çalışıyoruz.
es: Una mujer de las noticias hablaba para la cámara: —Probablemente no ha sido un ataque terrorista, nos dicen, pero la investigación acaba de empezar. El daño, como ven, es muy grave. Intentamos llegar a alguno de los supervivientes para interrogarlos sobre las declaraciones de testigos presenciales que indican que alguien cayó del arco.
vi_translation: A female reporter spoke in front of the camera: - According to what we know, this is probably not a terrorist attack. However, the authorities are still in the early stages of the investigation. As you can see, the damage is very severe. We are trying to reach the group of survivors. They witnessed firsthand someone falling from the top of the Gateway Arch.
tr_translation: A news anchor was speaking in front of the cameras. "We have been told that this is most likely not a terrorist attack, but a comprehensive investigation has not yet been conducted. As you can see, the damage is extensive. We are trying to find surviving eyewitnesses to get information about someone who fell from the bridge."
es_translation: A woman from the news was speaking to the camera: —It was probably not a terrorist attack, they tell us, but the investigation has just begun. The damage, as you can see, is very serious. We are trying to reach some of the survivors to question them about eyewitness statements indicating that someone fell from the arch.
st: Mofumahali oa litaba o ne a bua ka kh'amera: "Mohlomong ha se tlhaselo ea bokhukhuni, re bolelloa, empa e ntse e le kapele haholo lipatlisisong. Joalo ka ha u bona, ho thata haholo. Re leka ho fihla ho baphonyohi ba bang, ho ba botsa ka litlaleho tsa lipaki tsa motho e mong ea oelang Arch. "
yo: Arábìnrin ìròyìn kan ń sọ̀rọ̀ fún kámẹ́rà náà: "Bóyá kì í ṣe ìkọlù ọ̀daràn, wọ́n sọ fún wa, ṣùgbọ́n ó ṣì wà ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìwádìí náà. Ìbàjẹ́ náà, gẹ́gẹ́ bí o ṣe rí i, le gan-an. À ń gbìyànjú láti dé ọ̀dọ̀ díẹ̀ lára àwọn tí wọ́n yọ, láti bi wọ́n léèrè nípa ìròyìn ẹlẹ́rìí nípa ẹnìkan tí ó ṣubú láti Arch."
tn: Mosadi mongwe wa dikgang o ne a bua ka khamera e e reng: "Gongwe ga se tlhaselo ya borukhutlhi, re bolelelwa, mme go sa ntse go le thari mo dipatlisisong. Mme fela jaaka o bona, o a bona, o masisi. Re leka go bona batho ba le bantsi ba ba neng ba le mo go yone, re ba botsa ka dipego tsa batho ba ba neng ba tswa mo motseng wa Rona."
ty: Te parau ra te hoê vahine papai vea no te pata hoho'a e: "Peneia'e e ere i te hoê aroraa a te feia totoa, o tei parauhia mai râ, e mea oioi roa râ i roto i te maimiraa. Mai ta outou e ite ra, mea ino roa te ino. Te tamata nei matou i te haere e farerei i te tahi mau taata tei ora mai, no te uiui ia ratou no ni'a i te mau parau faaite a te hoê taata tei marua i raro mai ni'a mai i te apou ".
mai: एकटा समाचार महिला कैमराक लेल गप्प कऽ रहल छलीह: "संभवतः आतंकवादी हमला नहि, हमरासभकेँ कहल गेल अछि, मुदा जाञ्चमे एखनो बहुत जल्दी अछि। जेना कि अहां देख सकैत छी, क्षति बहुत गंभीर अछि। हमसभ बचि गेल किछु लोकक लग पहुँचबाक प्रयास कऽ रहल छी, हुनका सभसँ मेहराबसँ कियो खसि पड़बाक प्रत्यक्षदर्शी रिपोर्टक विषयमे पूछताछ करबाक प्रयास कऽ रहल छी।"
mg: Niresaka ho an'ny fakantsary ny ramatoa iray mpanao gazety: "Angamba tsy fanafihana mpampihorohoro, hoy izahay, saingy mbola aloha be amin'ny fanadihadiana izany. Araka ny hitanao, ny fahasimbana dia tena goavana. Miezaka ny ho any amin'ny sasany amin'ireo sisam-paty izahay, mba hanontany azy ireo momba ireo vavolombelona nanatri-maso ny olona nianjera avy tao amin'ny Arch.

en: Then I was looking through the mist at strawberry fields, and the Long Island Sound in the distance. We seemed to be on the porch of the Big House. Standing with his back to us at the railing was a sandy-haired guy in shorts and an orange tank top. He was holding a bronze sword and seemed to be staring intently at something down in the meadow.
vi: Giây lát sau, sau màn sương hiện lên ruộng dâu, eo biển Long Island phía xa như thể chúng tôi đang đứng trên thềm Nhà Lớn vậy. Cạnh lan can quanh thềm, quay lưng lại phía tôi là một thanh niên tóc vàng mặc quần soóc và áo thun da cam. Tay cầm kiếm đồng, anh ra chăm chú quan sát cánh đồng cỏ.
tr: Sonra, kendimi puslu Çilek tarlalarına ve Long Island Koyu'na bakarken buldum. Büyük Ev'in verandasında duruyorduk sanki. Tırabzanlarda, bize arkası dönük vaziyette duran, bir şort ve turuncu bir penye tişört giymiş kumral bir adam duruyordu. Elinde bronz bir kılıç vardı ve pür dikkat otlaklara bakıyordu.
es: Después tuve ante mí la niebla sobre los campos de fresas, y el canal de Long Island Sound en la distancia. Era como si estuviéramos en el porche de la Casa Grande. De pie, dándonos la espalda, había un tipo de pelo rubio apoyado en la barandilla, vestido con pantalones cortos y camiseta naranja. Tenía una espada de bronce en la mano y parecía estar mirando fijamente algo en el prado.
vi_translation: A moment later, through the mist, a mulberry field appeared, with the Long Island Sound in the distance as if we were standing on the porch of the Big House. By the railing around the porch, with his back turned to me, was a young man with blond hair wearing shorts and an orange T-shirt. Holding a bronze sword, he was intently observing the meadow.
tr_translation: Then, I found myself looking at the misty Strawberry fields and Long Island Sound. It was as if we were standing on the porch of the Big House. On the railings, there was a sandy-haired man wearing shorts and an orange t-shirt, standing with his back to us. He had a bronze sword in his hand and was intently watching the meadows.
es_translation: Then I had before me the fog over the strawberry fields, and the Long Island Sound channel in the distance. It was as if we were on the porch of the Big House. Standing, with his back to us, there was a blond-haired guy leaning on the railing, dressed in shorts and an orange t-shirt. He had a bronze sword in his hand and seemed to be staring at something in the meadow.
st: Ka mor'a moo, ke ile ka sheba ka har'a li-mushroom tse nang le molumo o molelele. Ho ne ho bonahala eka re ne re le mathuleng a ntlo e kholo. Ho ema le mokokotlo oa hae ho rona seporong e ne e le moshemane ea moriri o mokhuts'oane le tanka ea lamunu holimo. O ne a tšoere sabole ea boronse 'me ho bonahala eka o shebile ka sepheo se itseng ka har'a meadow.
yo: Lẹ́yìn náà mò ń wo ìkùukùu ní àwọn pápá strawberry, àti Long Island Sound ní ọ̀nà jíjìn. Ó dàbí ẹni pé a wà ní ìloro ilé ńlá náà. Dúró pẹ̀lú ẹ̀yìn rẹ̀ sí wa níbi ìkọ̀kọ̀ náà jẹ́ ọkùnrin tí ó ní irun iyanrìn nínú ṣòkòtò kéékèèké àti aṣọ aláwọ̀ ọsàn. Ó ń mú idà idẹ ó sì dàbí ẹni pé ó ń wo nkan kan ní ìsàlẹ̀ nínú oko.
tn: Ke ne ke lebile kwa masimong a matswaka, le modumo o moleele o o kwa kgakala. 'Re ne re le mo ntlong e kgolo' - We looked at the port of the big house O ne a eme fa morago ga rona fa a ne a le mo tseleng e e neng e le motho yo o nang le moriri o o mo khutshwakgang le tanka e e kwa godimo ya namune. O ne a tshwere thipa ya boronse mme a lebega a lebile sengwe se se kwa tlase mo motseng.
ty: I muri iho, te hi'o ra vau na roto i te rupehu i te mau faaapu fraise, e te ta'i ra te Long Island i te atea ê. E au ra e tei nia matou i te taupee o te Fare Rahi. Te ti'a noa ra to'na tua i piha'i iho ia matou i ni'a i te pa'epa'e, e taata one e te poto e te hoê pereoo pua tou. Te tapea ra oia i te hoê ' o'e veo e e au ra e te hi'o noa ra oia i te hoê mea i raro i te fenua.
mai: तखन हम स्ट्रॉबेरीक खेतमे धुंध आ दूरसँ लॉन्ग आइलैंड साउंड देख रहल छलहुँ। लगैत छल जे हम सभ बिग हाउसक पोर्च पर छी। रेलिंग पर हमरासभ दिस पीठ लऽ कऽ ठाढ़ एकटा रेतीला केशवला लड़का शॉर्ट्स आ नारंगी टैंक टॉप पहिरने छल। ओ कांस्यक तलवार पकड़ने छलाह आ एहन बुझाइत छलाह जे घासक मैदानमे कोनो चीजकेँ ध्यानसँ घूरि रहल छलाह।
mg: Avy eo dia nijery ny zavona teny amin'ny saha frezy aho, ary ny Long Island Sound tany lavitra. Toa teo amin'ny lavarangan'ny trano lehibe izahay. Nijoro niaraka tamin'ny lamosiny teo amin'ny lalamby ny lehilahy iray nisaron-doha tamin'ny pataloha fohy sy ny tampon'ny fiara mifono vy volomboasary. en: The moment I touched the shield, I knew we were in trouble. My hand broke through something that had been connecting it to the dashboard. A cobweb, I thought, but then I looked at a strand of it on my palm and saw it was some kind of metal filament, so fine it was almost invisible. A trip wire.
vi: Tay vừa chạm khiên, tôi biết ngay có sự chẳng lành. Bàn tay tôi vừa xuyên qua một thứ nối khiên với bảng điều khiển của xuồng máy. Tôi tưởng mạng nhện, nhưng khi giơ tay lên nhìn kỹ, hóa ra đó là dây kim loại rất mảnh, mắt thường gần như không nhìn thấy được. Một đoạn dây bẫy.
vi_results: "title": "The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde", "author": "Robert Louis Stevenson"
tr: Kalkana dokunduğum anda başımızın belada olduğunu anladım. Elim, kalkanı tutma yeriyle birleştiren yerde bir şeye takıldı. Örümcek ağı falan herhalde diye düşünürken, elime bulaşan şeye baktım ve bunun bir çeşit metal tel olduğunu fark ettim. O kadar inceydi ki, neredeyse görünmezdi. Bu bir tuzaktı.
tr_results: "title": "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo", "author": "Stieg Larsson"
es: En el momento en que toqué el escudo supe que teníamos problemas. Mi mano rompió algo que lo unía al tablero de mandos. Una telaraña, pensé, pero lo examiné en la palma y vi que era un delgado filamento de metal. Estaba puesto ahí para tropezar con él.
vi_translation: As soon as my hand touched the shield, I knew something was wrong. My hand had just passed through something that connected the shield to the control panel of the motorboat. I thought it was a spider web, but when I raised my hand to look closely, it turned out to be a very thin metal wire, almost invisible to the naked eye. A segment of a trap wire.
tr_translation: The moment I touched the shield, I realized we were in trouble. My hand got caught on something where the handle of the shield connected. Thinking it was probably a spider web or something, I looked at what had stuck to my hand and realized it was some kind of metal wire. It was so thin that it was almost invisible. This was a trap.
es_translation: The moment I touched the shield, I knew we were in trouble. My hand broke something that connected it to the control panel. A spider web, I thought, but I examined it in my palm and saw that it was a thin metal filament. It was placed there to trip over it.

en: Up on the rim, the Cupid statues were drawing their bows into firing position. Before I could suggest taking cover, they shot, but not at us. They fired at each other, across the rim of the pool. Silky cables trailed from the arrows, arcing over the pool and anchoring where they landed to form a huge golden asterisk. Then smaller metallic threads started weaving together magically between the main strands, making a net.
vi: Quanh thành hồ hình tròn, tượng Cupid giơ cung ngắm bán. Tôi chưa kịp kêu Annabeth tìm chỗ nấp, họ đã nhả tên. Nhưng họ không bắn chúng thôi mà bắn lẫn nhau: Tượng bên này bắn sang thành hồ đối diện. Những sợi dây kim loại mảnh theo mũi tên găm sang bờ bên kia tạo thành hình hoa thị bằng vàng. Sau đó, những sợi chỉ kim loại nhỏ xíu tự đan vào nhau dệt nên tấm lưới khổng lồ.
vi_results: "title": "Percy Jackson và Olympian: Biển trộ̂i số 1 - Chấu bóng bồng bòng", "author": "Rick Riordan"
tr: Kenardaki Eros heykelleri yaylarını germeye başladılar. Kaçın, saklanın, diye bağırmaya fırsat bulamadan, oklar yaydan fırlamıştı bile. Ama hedef biz değildik. Havuzun kenarlarından birbirlerine ok atıyorlardı. Oklardan çıkan incecik kablolar havuzun üzerinde birer yay çizip, karşı tarafa mıhlandı. Tellerin birleştikleri yerde kocaman, altın bir yıldız oluşmuştu. Sonra, daha ufak metal iplikçikler de gizemli bir biçimde birleşmeye başlayarak bir ağ ördüler. Oklardan incecik kablolar çıkıyor, havuzun üzerinden, aşağıya doğru nişan alıyordu. Birleştikleri yerde kocaman, altın bir yıldız oluşturuyorlardı. Sonra, daha ufak metal parçalar da gizemli bir biçimde birleşmeye başlayarak bir ağ ördüler.
es: Arriba, en el borde, las estatuas de Cupido tensaban sus arcos en posición de disparo. Sin darnos tiempo de ponernos a cubierto, dispararon, pero no hacia nosotros sino unas a otras, a ambos lados de la piscina. Las flechas arrastraban cables sedosos que describían arcos sobre la piscina y se clavaban en el borde, formando un enorme entramado dorado. Entonces, por arte de magia, empezaron a tejerse hilos metálicos más pequeños, entrelazándose hasta formar una red.
vi_translation: Around the circular lake, Cupid statues aimed their bows. I hadn't had time to tell Annabeth to find cover before they released their arrows. But they didn't shoot at us; they shot at each other: The statues on one side shot towards the opposite side of the lake. Thin metal wires followed the arrows and embedded themselves on the other shore, forming a golden star pattern. Then, the tiny metal threads wove themselves together to create a gigantic net.
tr_translation: The Eros statues on the corners began to draw their bows. Before we could shout, "Run, hide," the arrows had already been released from the bows. But we were not the target. They were shooting arrows at each other from the edges of the pool. The thin cables from the arrows arched over the pool and anchored on the opposite side. At the point where the wires met, a large golden star had formed. Then, smaller metal threads also began to mysteriously intertwine, weaving a net. Thin cables were emerging from the arrows, aiming downward over the pool. Where they converged, they formed a huge, golden star. Then, smaller metal pieces also began to mysteriously merge, weaving a web.
es_translation: Above, on the edge, the statues of Cupid drew their bows in shooting position. Without giving us time to take cover, they shot, but not at us, instead at each other, on both sides of the pool. The arrows dragged silky cables that described arcs over the pool and embedded themselves on the edge, forming a huge golden lattice. Then, as if by magic, smaller metallic threads began to weave, intertwining until they formed a net.
st: Holim'a moo, liemahale tsa Cupid li ne li hula liqha tsa tsona boemong ba ho thunya. Pele nka fana ka maikutlo a ho koahela, ba ile ba thunya, empa eseng ho rona. 'Me ba ile ba lelekoa mong ho e mong ho e mong, ho pholletsa le le rim ea letamo. Likhoele tsa Silky li ile tsa tloha metsu, li ntse li hloa ka holim'a letamo le ankora moo li ileng tsa fihla ho theha asterisk e kholo ea khauta. Joale likhoele tse nyane tsa tšepe li qalile ho loha hammoho ka boloi lipakeng tsa likhoele tse kholo, ho etsa letlooa.
yo: Lókè lórí ẹ̀gbẹ́, àwọn ère Cupid náà ń fa ọwọ́ wọn sí ipò ìbọn. Kí n tó lè dábàá láti bo ara wọn, wọ́n yìnbọn, ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe sí wa. Wọ́n yìnbọn sí ara wọn, kọjá ẹ̀gbẹ́ odò adágún. Àwọn okùn siliki tẹ̀lé e láti inú àwọn ọfà, tí wọ́n ń rìn lórí odò ìwẹ̀ tí wọ́n sì ń rìn níbi tí wọ́n ti balẹ̀ láti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ asterisk wúrà ńlá. Lẹ́yìn náà àwọn okùn irin kékeré bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní hun papọ̀ pẹ̀lú idán láàárín àwọn ọ̀nà pàtàkì, tí wọ́n ń ṣe àwọ̀n.

en: It was an army of wind-up creepy-crawlies: bronze-gear bodies, spindly legs, little pincer mouths, all scuttling toward us in a wave of clacking, whirring metal.
vi: Dòng chảy của những con vật ghê rợn tuồn vào mãi: mình bằng đồng, tám chân khẳng khiu và miệng nhỏ ngáp liên tục.
tr: Bronzdan yapılmış bedenler, örümcek bacakları ve minik kıskaçlı ağızlar, metalik sesler çıkararak, kurulmuş oyuncaklar gibi üzerimize üzerimize geliyordu.
es: Parecía un ejército de bichitos de cuerda: cuerpos de bronce, patas puntiagudas y afiladas pinzas, y se dirigían hacia nosotros como una marabunta, en una oleada de chasquidos y zumbidos metálicos.
vi_translation: The flow of terrifying creatures kept pouring in: bodies made of bronze, eight spindly legs, and small mouths continuously gaping.
tr_translation: Bodies made of bronze, spider legs, and tiny pincered mouths were coming at us like wound-up toys, making metallic sounds.
es_translation: It looked like an army of wind-up bugs: bronze bodies, pointed legs, and sharp pincers, and they were heading towards us like a swarm, in a wave of metallic clicks and buzzes.

en: Ares grabbed the shield and spun it in the air like pizza dough. It changed form, melting into a bulletproof vest. He slung it across his back.

en: The trailer was dark inside until I uncapped Anaklusmos. The blade cast a faint bronze light over a very sad scene. Sitting in a row of filthy metal cages were three of the most pathetic zoo animals I’d ever beheld: a zebra, a male albino lion, and some weird antelope thing I didn’t know the name for.
vi: Trong xe tối mù. Tôi mở nắp bút, dùng ánh sáng từ kiếm Thủy triều quan sát khung cảnh não nề. Ba chuồng sắt bẩn thỉu xếp thành dãy nhốt ba con thú hoang trông sầu thảm chưa từng thấy: một ngựa vằn, một sư tử đực lông trắng và một con thuộc loài linh dương trông rất lạ. Chuồng sư tử có bao củ cải.
vi_results: "title": "Journey to the Centre of the Earth", "author": "Jules Verne"
tr: Dalgakıran'ın kapağını açana kadar treyler kapkaranlıktı. Kılıçtan gelen zayıf bir ışık, hayatımda gördüğüm en acıklı sahneyi aydınlattı. Pis metal kafeslerin içinde, üç zavallı hayvan vardı. Biri bir zebraydı, ikincisi erkek bir albino aslan ve sonuncusu da adını bile bilmediğim antilop türü bir hayvan.
es: El interior del camión estaba oscuro, hasta que destapé a Anaklusmos. La espada arrojó una débil luz broncínea sobre una escena muy triste. En una fila de jaulas asquerosas había tres de los animales de zoo más patéticos que había visto jamás: una cebra, un león albino y una especie de antílope raro.
vi_translation: It was pitch dark inside the car. I opened the cap of my pen, using the light from the Tide Sword to observe the dismal scene. Three filthy iron cages arranged in a row contained three wild animals that looked more miserable than ever seen: a zebra, a white-maned lion, and a very strange-looking antelope. The lion's cage has a bunch of radishes.
tr_translation: Until the hatch of the breakwater was opened, the trailer was pitch dark. A weak light from the sword illuminated the most pitiful scene I had ever seen in my life. Inside the filthy metal cages, there were three miserable animals. One was a zebra, the second a male albino lion, and the last an antelope-like animal whose name I didn't even know.
es_translation: The inside of the truck was dark until I uncovered Anaklusmos. The sword cast a faint bronze light over a very sad scene. In a row of filthy cages were three of the most pathetic zoo animals I had ever seen: a zebra, an albino lion, and some kind of rare antelope.
st: E ne e le lefifi ka hare ho fihlela ke e-na le li-anaklusmos. Lehare le ile la etsa lebone le lengata la boronse holim'a sebaka se bohloko haholo. Ho lutse ka tatellano ea lihoke tsa tšepe tse litšila e ne e le liphoofolo tse tharo tsa liphoofolo tse pathetic tseo nkileng ka li ts'oana: zebra, tau e tona ea albino, le ntho e 'ngoe e makatsang ea antelope eo ke neng ke sa e tsebe.
yo: Ọkọ̀ àjàgbé náà dúdú nínú títí di ìgbà tí mo yọ Anaklusmos tí kò ní ààyè. Abẹ́ náà tan iná idẹ díẹ̀ lórí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìbànújẹ́. Jókòó ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àgọ́ irin ìdọ̀tí jẹ́ mẹ́ta nínú àwọn ẹranko ẹranko ẹranko tí ó burú jùlọ tí mo ti fọwọ́ sí rí: zebra, kìnnìún albino ọkùnrin, àti àwọn nkan ẹlẹ́rìndòdò àjèjì tí mi ò mọ orúkọ náà fún.
tn: Ke ne ke le mo teng ga me go fitlha ke sena go tsena mo ntlong. Mogatla wa yone o ne wa dira gore go nne le lesedi le le kwa godimo ga lefelo le le botlhoko thata. Ke ne ke le mo sekgweng se se nang le ditshika tse tharo tse di gaisang tsotlhe tse nkileng ka di bona: Pitse, tau e tona ya albino, le selo se sennye se se sa tlwaelegang se ke neng ke sa se itse.

Te parahi ra vau i roto i te hoê anairaa afata auri reporepo, e toru ïa o te mau animala riaria roa ' ' e o ta ' u i ore i ite a'enei: te hoê asini oviri, te hoê liona oni albino, e te tahi mau mea o ta ' u i ore i ite i te i'oa.

en: “Yeah,” she said. “Every August, the counselors pick the most important event of the summer, and they paint it on that year’s beads. I’ve got Thalia’s pine tree, a Greek trireme on fire, a centaur in a prom dress-now that was a weird summer….”

es: —Sí —contestó—. Cada agosto, los consejeros eligen el evento más importante del verano y lo pintan en las cuentas de ese año. Tengo el pino de Thalia, un trirreme griego en llamas, un centauro con traje de graduación... Bueno, ése sí que fue un verano raro...

vi_translation: - Yes. Every year, in August, the camp counselors choose the most important event of the summer to paint on the ceramic beads. I have the image of Thalia's pine tree, a burning ancient trireme, a centaur in a ball gown... this summer is the strangest...
tr_translation: "Yes," he said. "Every August, the members of the council choose the most important event of the summer and engrave it on that year's bead. I have a bead with Thalia's pine tree, a burning Greek trireme, and a centaur in a ball gown... It was quite a strange summer..."
es_translation: —Yes —he replied—. Every August, the counselors choose the most important event of the summer and paint it on the beads for that year. I have Thalia's pine tree, a Greek trireme in flames, a centaur in a graduation suit... Well, that was indeed a strange summer...

en: “Meaning they’ll reach the wild safely,” he said. “They’ll find water, food, shade, whatever they need until they find a safe place to live.”

es: —Significa que llegarán a la espesura a salvo —dijo—. Encontrarán agua, comida, sombra, todo lo que necesiten hasta hallar un lugar donde vivir a salvo.
vi_translation: - It means they will return to the forest safely. They will find water, food, ... anything they need until they reach their old place.
tr_translation: "So they will reach the wilderness without any accidents or troubles," he said. "Water, food, shade, whatever their needs are, they will find a safe place where they can live easily."
es_translation: —It means they will reach the thicket safely —he said—. They will find water, food, shade, everything they need until they find a place to live safely.
