en: “No, no,” he said, laughing. “The bill’s taken care of. No extra charges, no tips. Just go on up to the top floor, loom 4001. If you need anything, like extra bubbles for the hot tub, or skeet targets for the shooting range, or whatever, just call the front desk. Here are your LotusCash cards. They work in the restaurants and on all the games and rides.”
vi: Ông ta cười xòa: - Đừng lo. Có người thanh toán mọi khoản rồi. Ở đây không thu phụ phí, không đòi tiền boa. Cứ lên phòng trên cùng, phòng 4001. Nếu cần bất cứ thứ gì, chẳng hạn thêm dầu tạo bọt cho bồn tắm nước nóng hay đạn đất sét tập bắn chim câu, cứ việc gọi tiếp tân. Đây là thẻ tín dụng LotusCash dùng trong nhà hàng, các máy chơi game và mọi phương tiện đi lại.
tr: "Hayır, hayır," dedi çocuk gülerek. "Hesap ödendi bile. Fazladan bir şey ödemeyeceksiniz. Sadece en üst kata çıkın ve 4001 numaralı odaya gidin. Banyo köpüğü veya atış talimi için hedef gibi bir şeye ihtiyacınız olursa, hemen resepsiyonu arayın. İşte bunlar da LotusNakit kartlarınız. Bunlar restoranlarda, tüm oyunlarda ve diğer aktivitelerde geçerlidir.
es: —No, no —dijo sonriendo—. La cuenta está pagada. No tienen que pagar nada ni dar propinas. Sencillamente suban a la última planta, habitación cuatro mil uno. Si necesitan algo, como más burbujas para la bañera caliente, o platos en el campo de tiro, lo que sea, llamen a recepción. Aquí tienen sus tarjetas LotusCash. Funcionan en los restaurantes y en todos los juegos y atracciones.
vi_translation: He laughed heartily: - Don't worry. Someone has already paid for everything. There are no additional fees here, no tipping required. Just go to the top floor, room 4001. If you need anything, such as extra bubble bath for the hot tub or clay pigeon shooting ammo, just call the reception. This is a LotusCash credit card for use in the restaurant, gaming machines, and all transportation.
tr_translation: "No, no," said the child, laughing. "The bill has already been paid. You won't have to pay anything extra. Just go to the top floor and head to room 4001. If you need something like bath foam or a target for shooting practice, just call the reception immediately. Here are your LotusCash cards. These are valid at restaurants, all games, and other activities."
es_translation: —No, no —he said, smiling—. The bill is paid. You don't have to pay anything or give tips. Simply go up to the top floor, room four thousand one. If you need anything, like more bubbles for the hot tub, or plates at the shooting range, whatever it is, call reception. Here are your LotusCash cards. They work in the restaurants and in all the games and attractions.
st: "Che," a rialo a bososela. "Bill o ile a hlokomela. Ha ho litefiso tse eketsehileng, ha ho na malebela. E-ea feela ho fihlela mokatong o kaholimo, Loom 4001. Haeba u hloka eng kapa eng, joalo ka bubble e eketsehileng bakeng sa tub e chesang, kapa liphofu bakeng sa ho thunya, kapa eng kapa eng, letsetsa feela tafole e ka pele. yo: "Rárá, rárá," ó sọ, ó rẹ́rìn-ín. "Awọn owo ti wa ni ya itoju ti. Kò sí àfikún owó, kò sí ìmọ̀ràn. Kàn lọ sókè sí àjà òkè, loom 4001. Tí o bá nílò ohunkóhun, gẹ́gẹ́ bí àfikún fọ́ọ̀bù fún ìwẹ̀ gbígbóná, tàbí àfojúsùn skeet fún ààyè ìbọn, tàbí ohunkóhun mìíràn, kàn pe tábìlì iwájú. Eyi ni awọn kaadi LotusCash rẹ. en: Then we burst through the doors of the Lotus Casino and ran down the sidewalk. It felt like afternoon, about the same time of day we’d gone into the casino, but something was wrong. The weather had completely changed. It was stormy, with heat lightning flashing out in the desert.
vi: Lát sau, ba đứa đẩy cửa sòng bài Hoa Sen, hoảng hốt chạy dọc con phố. Bên ngoài là buổi chiều, tầm giờ lúc vào khách sạn. Nhưng thực ra không phải. Hôm nay thời tiết u ám, chớp rạch ngang bầu trời ngoài sa mạc.
tr: Sonra, Lotus Kumarhanesi'nin kapılarından apar topar dışarı çıktık ve kaldırımda koşmaya başladık. Kumarhaneye girdiğimiz zamanki gibi öğleden sonraydı ama bir terslik vardı. Hava tamamıyla değişmişti. Fırtına çıkmış, çölde şimşekler çakıyordu.
es: Salimos a toda prisa del Casino Loto y corrimos por la acera. Era por la tarde, aproximadamente la misma hora del día que habíamos entrado en el casino, pero algo no cuadraba. El clima había cambiado por completo. Había tormenta y el desierto rielaba por el calor.
vi_translation: Moments later, the three of them pushed open the door of the Hoa Sen casino, panicked, and ran along the street. Outside, it was the afternoon, around the time they had entered the hotel. But in reality, it wasn't. Today, the weather was gloomy, with lightning streaking across the desert sky.
tr_translation: Then, we hurriedly ran out of the doors of the Lotus Casino and started running on the sidewalk. It was afternoon, just like when we entered the casino, but something was wrong. The weather had completely changed. A storm had broken out, and lightning was striking in the desert.
es_translation: We hurried out of the Loto Casino and ran along the sidewalk. It was in the afternoon, approximately the same time of day we had entered the casino, but something didn't add up. The weather had changed completely. There was a storm and the desert shimmered with heat.
st: Ka mor'a moo, re ile ra phatloha ka mamati a Lotus Casino ebe re matha ka tsela e ka tlase. en: The cigar fell out of the driver’s mouth. He looked back at us, his eyes wide. “Where to in Los Angeles… uh, Your Highness?”
vi: Điếu xì gà rớt khỏi miệng bác tài. Ông ngạc nhiên nhìn chúng tôi: - Đến địa điểm nào ở Los Angeles, thưa… Quý Cô?
tr: Şoförün sigarası ağzından düştü. Gözlerini fal taşı gibi açarak, bize döndü, "Los Angeles'ta nereye gitmek istersiniz, şey... Majesteleri?" diye sordu.
es: Al hombre se le cayó el puro de la boca. Volvió a mirarnos, esta vez con los ojos como platos. —¿A qué parte de Los Ángeles... esto, alteza?
vi_translation: The cigar fell from the driver's mouth. He looked at us in surprise: - To which location in Los Angeles, Madam?
tr_translation: The driver's cigarette fell from his mouth. He turned to us, eyes wide open, and asked, "Where would you like to go in Los Angeles, um... Your Majesty?"
es_translation: The man's cigar fell from his mouth. He looked at us again, this time with eyes wide open. —To which part of Los Angeles... this, your highness?

en: But the thing wasn’t attacking. It was nuzzling me. Heeling like a dog. Tentatively, I touched its dorsal fin. It bucked a little, as if inviting me to hold tighter. I grabbed the fin with both hands. It took off, pulling me along. The shark carried me down into the darkness. It deposited me at the edge of the ocean proper, where the sand bank dropped off into a huge chasm. It was like standing on the rim of the Grand Canyon at midnight, not being able to see much, but knowing the void was right there.
vi: Nhưng con vật không cắn, nó rúc mõm nép vào tôi như con chó nhà. Tôi rụt rè chạm vây lưng cá. Nó vui vẻ quẫy nhẹ, khuyến khích tôi nắm chặt hơn. Tôi giữ vây cá bằng cả hai tay. Nó bơi vút đi, kéo tôi theo. Nếu độc giả chưa bao giờ cưỡi cá mập, cũng đừng tự tìm cách thử... Tuy nhiên, phải công nhận cảm giác ấy tuyệt vời hơn bất kì buổi tập trượt băng nào. Cá mập đưa tôi vào vùng nước tối. Nó thả tôi ngay chỗ cát dưới đáy biển sụt xuống thành vực sâu thẳm. Tôi như đứng trên miệng hẻm núi vĩ đại Grand Canyon giữa đêm hôm khuya khoắt. Dù không nhìn rõ lắm nhưng vẫn biết có khoảng trống mênh mông, sâu hun hút dưới kia.
tr: Ama bana saldırmıyordu. Sadece burnuyla dürtüyordu. Bir köpek gibi, dizimin dibinden ayrılmıyordu. Korkarak köpekbalığının sırtındaki yüzgece dokundum. Biraz geri çekildi ama sanki onu daha da sıkı sıkıya tutmam için yapmıştı bunu. Yüzgeci iki elimle birden kavradım. Köpekbalığı beni de çekerek yola koyuldu. Beni karanlığın içine doğru götürüyordu. Sonra, tam kocaman bir uçurumun başladığı yerde, tam kenarda beni bıraktı. Gece yarısı Büyük Kanyon'un kenarında durmak gibi bir şeydi bu. Fazla bir şey göremiyordum ama boşluğun orada olduğunu da biliyordum.
es: Pero el bicho no atacaba. Tan sólo me olisqueaba. Me seguía como un perrito. Le toqué la aleta dorsal con cautela y el tiburón corcoveó un poco, como invitándome a agarrarme con fuerza. Me así a la aleta con las dos manos y el escualo salió disparado, arrastrándome con él. Me condujo hacia la oscuridad y me depositó en el límite mismo del océano, donde el banco de arena se despeñaba hacia un enorme abismo. Era como estar al borde del Gran Cañón a medianoche, sin ver demasiado pero consciente de que el vacío está justo ahí.
vi_translation: But the animal didn't bite; it nestled its snout against me like a house dog. I timidly touched the fish's dorsal fin. It happily wiggled lightly, encouraging me to hold on tighter. I held the fish's fin with both hands. It swam swiftly, pulling me along. If the reader has never ridden a shark, don't try to find a way to do it yourself... However, one must admit that the feeling is more wonderful than any ice skating practice. The shark took me into the dark waters. It dropped me right where the sand at the bottom of the sea sank into a deep abyss. I felt like I was standing on the edge of the Grand Canyon in the dead of night. Even though I couldn't see clearly, I still knew there was a vast, deep chasm below.
tr_translation: But it wasn't attacking me. It was just nudging me with its nose. Like a dog, it wouldn't leave my side. Fearfully, I touched the fin on the shark's back. It pulled back a little, but it seemed to do this so that I would hold on even tighter. I grasped the fin with both of my hands. The shark started to move, pulling me along. It was taking me into the darkness. Then, right at the edge where a huge abyss began, it left me. It was like standing at the edge of the Grand Canyon at midnight. I couldn't see much, but I knew the void was there.
es_translation: But the creature did not attack. It only sniffed me. It followed me like a puppy. I cautiously touched its dorsal fin and the shark bucked a little, as if inviting me to hold on tightly. I grabbed the fin with both hands and the shark shot off, dragging me with it. It led me into the darkness and deposited me at the very edge of the ocean, where the sandbank plunged into a huge abyss. It was like being on the edge of the Grand Canyon at midnight, not seeing much but aware that the void is right there.
st: Empa ntho eo ha ea ka ea hlasela. E ne e le ntho e nkisatsang. Like a dog, like a dog. ʻO ka hoʻomaka ʻana i ka ʻike a me ka hoʻomaka. E ile ea ntšoara hanyane, joalo ka ha eka ke ile ka nkopa hore ke tšoare ka thata. Ke ile ka tšoara qetellong ka matsoho ka bobeli. E ile ea ntšosa, ea nkopa. Leru le ile la ntsamaisa lefifing. E ile ea ntsamaisa ka lehlakoreng la leoatle hantle, moo banka ea lehlabathe e ileng ea theohela ka har'a chasm e kholo. Ho ne ho tšoana le ho ema bohareng ba Grand Canyon ka har'a mp'a bosiu, a sa khone ho bona haholo, empa ho tseba hore void e ne e le hantle moo.
yo: Ṣùgbọ́n nkan náà kò kọlù. Ó ń bà mí nínú jẹ́. Ìtẹ̀lẹ̀ bí ajá. Ní ìdánilójú, mo fọwọ́ kan ẹ̀yìn dorsal rẹ̀. Ó dọ́là díẹ̀,àfi bí ẹni pé ó ń pè mí wá kí n wá dúró dáadáa. Ọwọ́ méjèèjì ni mo fi gbá fin náà mú. Ó gbéra, ó fà mí sílẹ̀. Ẹja ṣáàkì náà gbé mi sọ̀kalẹ̀ sínú òkùnkùn. Ó fi mí sí etí òkun dáadáa, níbi tí ilé ìfowópamọ́ iyanrìn ti ṣubú sínú chasm ńlá. Ó dàbí dídúró lórí ẹ̀gbẹ́ Grand Canyon ní ọ̀gànjọ́ òru, láì rí púpọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n mímọ̀ pé àlàfo náà wà níbẹ̀.

ty: Aita râ te reira i tupu noa a'e. Ua ri'ari'a roa vau. Te horo - ê - raa mai te hoê urî ra te huru. Ma te mǎrû, ua tapea ' tura vau i to ' na fin. Ua puta rii mai te reira, mai te huru ra e, te titau manihini mai nei oia ia'u ia tape'a maitai. Ua haru a'era vau i te fanau'a e na rima e piti. Ua mau te reira i roto i to'u arapo'a, e ua huti ia'u. Ua amo te ma'o ia'u i roto i te poiri. Ua vai noa te reira i te hiti o te moana, i reira te one i te toparaa i roto i te hoê apoo rahi. Mai te huru ra e, te ti'a noa ra vau i ni'a i te tupua'i mou'a no Grand Canyon i te tuiraa pô, ma te ite ore e, te vai ra te hoê apoo i reira.
mai: मुदा बात हमला नहि कए रहल छलइ। इ हमरा परेशान कए रहल छल। कुत्ता जकां एड़ी लगैत अछि। अस्थायी रूप सं, हम ओकर पृष्ठीय पंख के छू लेलहुं। इ कने झुकि गेल, जेना हमरा कड़ा पकड़ए के लेल आमंत्रित कए रहल होइ। हम दुनू हाथ सं पंख पकड़ि लेलहुं। इ उड़ि गेल, हमरा संग खींचि लेलक। शार्क हमरा अन्हार मे लए गेल। ई हमरा समुद्रक ठीक किनार पर जमा कऽ देलक, जतय बालु तट एकटा विशाल खाईमे खसि पड़ल। ई मध्यरात्रिमे ग्रैंड कैन्यनक रिम पर ठाढ़ होयबाक जकाँ छल, बेसी नहि देखि पाबि रहल छल, मुदा शून्यकेँ जनैत ठीक ओतहि छल।
mg: Saingy tsy nanafika ny zava-misy. Nampaninona ahy izany. Izy dia tahaka ny alika. Nikasika ny vombony aho, tamin'ny voalohany. Somary nikorontana kely ilay izy, toy ny hoe nanasa ahy hihenjana kokoa. Noraisiko tamin'ny tanako roa ilay vombo. Niainga ilay izy, nisintona ahy. Ny antsantsa no nitondra ahy ho any amin'ny maizina. Nametraka ahy teo amin'ny sisin'ny ranomasina araka ny tokony ho izy izany, izay nidinan'ny moron-dranomasina tao anaty hantsana goavana. Toy ny nijoro teo amin'ny sisin'ny Grand Canyon tamin'ny misasakalina izany, tsy afaka nahita zavatra betsaka, saingy nahafantatra fa teo ilay fahabangana.

en: My mind was racing. I knew I couldn’t take on this giant water-bed salesman alone. He would snap my neck before I ever got my sword out.
vi: Tôi tính toán thật nhanh. Mình tôi đấu với gã chủ tiệm khác nào trứng chọi đá. Hắn sẽ bẻ gãy cổ tôi trước khi tôi kịp rút kiếm.
tr: Başım dönüyordu. Bu dev gibi su yatağı satıcısını tek başıma yenemeyeceğimi biliyordum. Daha kılıcımı çekmeden boynumu kırardı.
tr_results: "title": "The Old Man and the Sea", "author": "Ernest Hemingway"
es: La cabeza me iba a cien por hora. Sabía que no podía enfrentarme solo a aquel grandullón. Me rompería el cuello antes de que la espada se desplegase.
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra"
vi_translation: I calculated really quickly. Me alone fighting the shop owner is like an egg hitting a rock. He would break my neck before I could draw my sword.
tr_translation: My head was spinning. I knew I couldn't defeat this giant waterbed salesman on my own. He would break my neck before I could even draw my sword.
es_translation: My head was spinning a hundred miles an hour. I knew I couldn't face that big guy alone. He would break my neck before the sword could unfold.

en: I looked at the bulletin board behind Crusty’s sales desk. There was an advertisement for Hermes Delivery Service, and another for the All-New Compendium of L.A. Area Monsters-“The only Monstrous Yellow Pages you’ll ever need!” Under that, a bright orange flier for DOA Recording Studios, offering commissions for heroes’ souls. “We are always looking for new talent!” DOA’s address was right underneath with a map.
vi: Bảng thông báo sau bàn làm việc của Crusty có mẩu quảng cáo cho dịch vụ Phát Chuyển Nhanh Hermes và phần quảng cáo khác cho niên giám điện thoại mới của riêng giới yêu quái trong khu vực Los Angeles. “Niên giám những trang vàng của giới yêu quái đầy đủ thông tin nhất”. Dưới đó có tờ rơi màu vàng của phòng thu âm DOA hứa có thưởng cho ai giao nộp linh hồn con lai. “Chúng tôi luôn tìm kiếm tài năng trẻ!” Ngay dưới là địa chỉ DOA, kèm theo sơ đồ chỉ dẫn đường tới đó.
tr: Kabuklu'nun masasının orada duran panoya baktım. Hermes Nakliye Hizmetleri'nin ve Los Angeles Bölgesi Canavarlarıyla İlgili Özlü Bilgiler Kitabı'nm reklamları asılıydı. "Canavarlarla İlgili Bilgi Bulabileceğiniz Tek Sarı Sayfalar!" diyordu ilan. Onun altında da NSÖ Plakçılık'ın parlak turuncu broşürü duruyordu. Broşürde kahramanların ruhlarına karşılık komisyon verildiği yazıyordu. "Yeni yetenekler arıyoruz!" diyen broşürde, NSÖ'nün adresi bir haritayla birlikte verilmişti.
es: Miré en el tablón de anuncios detrás del mostrador de Crusty. Había un anuncio del servicio de entregas Hermes, y otro del Nuevo y completo compendio de la Zona Monstruo de Los Angeles: «¡Las únicas páginas amarillas monstruosas que necesita!» Debajo, un panfleto naranja de los estudios de grabación El Otro Barrio ofrecía incentivos por las almas de los héroes. «¡Buscamos nuevos talentos!» La dirección de EOB estaba indicada justo debajo con un mapa.
vi_translation: The bulletin board behind Crusty's desk had an advertisement for Hermes Express Delivery Service and another ad for the new phone directory exclusively for the supernatural community in the Los Angeles area. “The most comprehensive Yellow Pages for the supernatural community.” Below that was a yellow flyer from DOA Recording Studios promising a reward for anyone who turned in a demigod's soul. “We are always looking for young talent!” Just below was the DOA address, along with a map showing the way there.
tr_translation: I looked at the bulletin board standing by Kabuklu's desk. Advertisements for Hermes Shipping Services and the Concise Book of Information on the Monsters of the Los Angeles Area were posted. "The Only Yellow Pages Where You Can Find Information About Monsters!" said the ad. Below it was a bright orange brochure from NSÖ Records. The brochure stated that commissions were given in exchange for the souls of heroes. The brochure, which said "We are looking for new talents!", provided NSÖ's address along with a map.
es_translation: I looked at the bulletin board behind Crusty's counter. There was an ad for Hermes delivery service, and another for the New and Complete Compendium of the Monster Zone of Los Angeles: "The only monstrous yellow pages you need!" Below, an orange pamphlet from El Otro Barrio recording studios offered incentives for the souls of heroes. "We are looking for new talents!" The address of EOB was indicated just below with a map.
st: Ke ile ka sheba ka mor'a tafole ea makhasi a makhasi a makhasi. Ho na le e ne e le papatso bakeng sa Hermes Delivery Service, le e 'ngoe bakeng sa All-New Compendium ea L.A Area Monsters-"The feela Monstrous Yellow Pages u tla hloka! " Tlas'a moo, flier e khanyang ea lamunu bakeng sa DOA Recording Studios, e fana ka likomishene bakeng sa meea ea bahale. "Re lula re batlana le talenta e ncha!" Aterese ea Doa e ne e le ka tlasa 'mapa.
yo: Mo wo pátákó ìwé ìròyìn lẹ́yìn tábìlì ìtajà Crusty. Ìpolówó kan wà fún Iṣẹ́ Ìfijíṣẹ́ Hermes, àti òmíràn fún All-New Compendium of LA Area Monsters-"The Only Monstrous Yellow Pages tí o máa nílò!" Lábẹ́ ìyẹn, ìwé ìròyìn aláwọ̀ ọsàn tí ó mọ́lẹ̀ fún DOA Recording Studios, tí ó ń pèsè ìgbìmọ̀ fún ọkàn àwọn akọni. "Nigbagbogbo a n wa talenti tuntun!" Àdírẹ́sì DOA wà ní abẹ́ pẹ̀lú máàpù.
tn: Ke ne ka leba kwa morago ga go rekisa di-crusty's desk. Go ne go na le papatso ya Tirelo ya Tlamelo ya Hermes, mme e nngwe ya Compendium ya All-New Compendium of L.A. Area Monsters- The only Monstrous Yellow Pages you will need! Ka fa tlase ga moo, namune e e phatsimang ya DoA Recording Studios, e e nayang dikhomishene tsa bagale. 'We've always looking for a new talent' - Re ntse re batlana le bokgoni jo bosha Aterese ya ga Doda e ne e le ka fa tlase ga mmapa.
ty: Ua hi'o vau i te iri piaraa parau i muri mai i te iri hooraa tao'a a Crusty. Te vai ra te hoê parau faatiani na Hermes Delivery Service, e te tahi no te faanahoraa All-New Compendium no L.A. Area Monsters-" Te mau api auro hoê roa o ta outou e hinaaro ! " I raro a'e i te reira, te vai ra te hoê hoho'a peni anani no te doA Recording Studios, o te pûpû i te mau faaueraa no te mau varua o te mau aito. " E imi noa matou i te taleni apî ! " Tei raro a'e roa te vahi nohoraa o DOA i te hoê hoho'a fenua.
mai: हम क्रस्टीक बिक्री डेस्कक पाछू बुलेटिन बोर्ड देखलहुं। हर्मिस डिलीवरी सर्विसक लेल एकटा विज्ञापन छल, आ दोसर एलए एरिया मॉन्स्टर्सक ऑल-न्यू कम्पेंडियम लेल छल- "एकमात्र राक्षसी पीत पृष्ठ जकर अहाँकेँ कहियो आवश्यकता होयत!" ओकर अन्तर्गत डीओए रिकॉर्डिंग स्टूडियोक लेल एकटा उज्ज्वल नारंगी रंगक फ्लायर, जे नायकक आत्माक लेल कमीशन प्रदान करैत अछि। "हम सभ सदिखन नव प्रतिभाक तलाश मे रहैत छी!" डीओएक पता नक्शाक ठीक नीचा छल।
mg: Nijery ny tabilaon'ny bilaogy tao ambadiky ny biraon'ny varotra Crusty aho. Eo ambanin'izany, flier manga mamirapiratra ho an'ny DOA Recording Studios, manolotra vaomiera ho an'ny fanahin'ireo mahery fo. "Mitady talenta vaovao foana izahay!" en: “Right. Now, no one get any ideas while I’m gone,” he announced to the waiting room. “And if anyone moves the dial off my easy-listening station again, I’ll make sure you’re here for another thousand years. Understand?”
vi: Hắn oang oang nói với cả phòng: Ai hỏi ta đi đâu, cấm đứa nào nói. Kẻ nào hé môi sẽ phải chờ thêm một ngàn năm nữa. Nhớ chưa?
tr: Lobidekilere dönerek "Tamam. Şimdi, ben yokken uslu durun bakalım." dedi. "Eğer hafif müzik istasyonunu değiştirmeye yeltenen olursa, bir bin yıl daha burada beklersiniz. Anlaşıldı mı?
es: —Vale. Escuchad: que a nadie se le ocurra pasarse de listo en mi ausencia —anunció a la sala de espera—. Y si alguno vuelve a tocar el dial de mi micrófono, me aseguraré de que paséis aquí mil años más. ¿Entendido?
vi_translation: He loudly said to the whole room: If anyone asks where I am going, no one is allowed to tell. Anyone who opens their mouth will have to wait another thousand years. Got it?
tr_translation: Turning to the lobsters, "Alright. Now, behave yourselves while I'm gone." he said. "If anyone dares to change the light music station, you'll wait here for another millennium. Understood?"
es_translation: —Okay. Listen: nobody better try to get clever in my absence —he announced to the waiting room—. And if anyone touches the dial on my microphone again, I'll make sure you spend a thousand more years here. Understood?

en: Mist curled off the filthy water. Above us, almost lost in the gloom, was a ceiling of stalactites. Ahead, the far shore glimmered with greenish light, the color of poison.
en_results: "title": "Journey to the Centre of the Earth", "author": "Jules Verne"
vi: Sương bảng lảng trên mặt sông dơ dáy. Cao tít phía trên là vòm hang đầy nhủ đá. Trước mặt, mơi bến bờ xa tắp tỏa ánh sáng xanh lục, màu của chất độc.
tr: Pis sudan sisler çıkıyordu. Tam üstümüzde sislerin arasında, sarkıtlardan oluşmuş bir tavan vardı. İleride gözüken kıyı, yeşilimsi, zehir renginde parıldıyordu.
es: La niebla se enroscó sobre la mugrienta agua. Por encima de nosotros, casi perdido en la penumbra, había un techo de estalactitas. Más adelante, la otra orilla brillaba con una luz verdosa, del color del veneno.
vi_translation: The mist drifts over the filthy river. High above is a cave ceiling full of stalactites. In front, the distant shore emits a green light, the color of poison.
tr_translation: Steam was rising from the water. Right above us, amidst the mist, there was a ceiling made of stalactites. The shore visible ahead was shimmering in a greenish, poisonous hue.
es_translation: The fog curled over the filthy water. Above us, almost lost in the dim light, there was a ceiling of stalactites. Further ahead, the other shore glowed with a greenish light, the color of poison.
st: ʻO ka hoʻoholo ʻana i ka hoʻoholo ʻana i ka hoʻoholo. Ka holim'a rona, hoo e batlang e lahlehile, e ne e le siling ea stalactites. Ka mor'a moo, lebopo le hole le na le khanya e tala, 'mala oa chefo.
yo: Ìkùukùu yí kúrò nínú omi ìdọ̀tí. Lókè wa, ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ sọnù nínú ìbànújẹ́, jẹ́ àjà àwọn stalactites. Níwájú, etí òkun jíjìn náà kún fún ìmọ́lẹ̀ aláwọ̀ ewé, àwọ̀ májèlé.
tn: O ne a tlosa metsi a a sa tswang go tswa mo go lone. Mo godimo ga rona, re batlile re latlhegelwa ke dilo tse di neng di le mo godimo ga tsone, e ne e le lefelo le le neng le le mo go lone. Kwa pele, lebopo le le kwa godimo le ne le na le botala jo botala, mmala wa botlhole.

tr_translation: We had gotten even closer to the doors. The howling had become so terrible that the ground I was standing on was shaking. Despite this, I still couldn't figure out where the sound was coming from.
es_translation: We approached the doors. The screams were so loud that they made the ground under my feet vibrate, although I still couldn't locate where they were coming from.

en: The dead walked right up to him-no fear at all. The ATTENDANT ON DUTY lines parted on either side of him. The EZ DEATH spirits walked right between his front paws and under his belly, which they could do without even crouching.
en_results: "title": "Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats", "author": "Old Possum"
vi: Người chết không hề sợ hãi tiến thẳng đến chỗ nó. Dòng người ở hai hàng SẴN SÀNG PHỤC VỤ đi sát hai bên cạnh nó. Còn hàng EZ DEATH đi giữa hai chân vuốt dài nhọn, chui dưới bụng nó mà không cần khom người.
tr: Ölüler doğrudan ona doğru yürüyorlardı. Hiçbiri korkmuyordu. GÖREVLİ yazan kuyruktakiler, Kerberus'un yanına geçiyorlardı. KOLAY ÖLÜM ruhlarıysa Kerberus'un ön pençelerine ve karnının altına doğru yürüyor, bunu yaparken de eğilmelerine bile gerek kalmıyordu.
es: Los muertos caminaban directamente hacia él: no tenían miedo. Las filas en servicio se apartaban de él cada una a un lado. Los espíritus camino de muerte rápida pasaban justo entre sus patas delanteras y bajo su estómago, cosa que hacían sin necesidad de agacharse.
vi_translation: The dead person fearlessly advanced straight towards it. The line of people in the two rows READY TO SERVE walked closely on either side of it. Meanwhile, the EZ DEATH line moved between its long sharp claws, crawling under its belly without needing to bend down.
tr_translation: The dead were walking directly towards him. None of them were afraid. Those in the line marked OFFICIAL were passing by Cerberus. The souls of EASY DEATH were walking towards Cerberus's front paws and under his belly, without even needing to bend down while doing so.
es_translation: The dead walked directly towards him: they were not afraid. The rows on duty moved aside for him, each to one side. The spirits on the path of quick death passed right between his front legs and under his stomach, which they did without needing to duck.
st: Bafu ba ne ba sa tšabe letho ho eena. Sehlopha sa hae sa mosebetsi se ne se le ka lehlakoreng lefe kapa lefe. Meea ea EZ Lefu e ile ea tsamaea hantle lipakeng tsa li-paws tsa hae tse ka pele le ka tlas'a mpa ea hae, eo ba neng ba ka e etsa ntle le ho latsoa.
yo: Àwọn òkú rìn tọ̀ ọ́ wá sí ọ̀dọ̀ rẹ̀ - kò bẹ̀rù rárá. Àwọn ìlà ATTENDANT ON DUTY pínyà ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ méjèèjì rẹ̀. Àwọn ẹ̀mí IKÚ EZ rìn láàárín ẹsẹ̀ iwájú rẹ̀ àti lábẹ́ ikùn rẹ̀, èyí tí wọ́n lè ṣe láì tilẹ̀ tẹríba.

Mewa ya EZ e ne ya tsamaya ka fa gare ga digokgo tsa gagwe tse di kwa pele le ka fa tlase ga mpa ya gagwe, e ba neng ba ka e dira e bile ba sa eletse.

en: I took the big stick out of my backpack-a bedpost I’d broken off Crusty’s Safari Deluxe floor model. I held it up, and tried to channel happy dog thoughts toward Cerberus-Alpo commercials, cute little puppies, fire hydrants. I tried to smile, like I wasn’t about to die.
en_results: "title": "Percy Jackson and the Lightning Thief", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi: Tôi lấy cây gậy lớn trong ba lô. Thực ra đó là chân giường Safari Deluxe của Crusty. Vừa giơ gậy, tôi vừa cố tìm cách liên tưởng Cerberus với những y tưởng vui vẻ về chó: chẳng hạn những mẫu quảng cáo thức ăn cho chó, cún con xinh xắn hoặc vòi nước cứu hỏa. Gượng cười, tôi cố quên rằng mình sắp chết.
tr: Sırt çantamdan büyük sopayı çıkardım; bunu Kabuklu'nun dükkanındaki Lüks Safari modelinden koparmıştım. Sopayı havaya kaldırıp, Kerberus'a mutlu köpek düşünceleri iletmeye çalıştım. Sürekli olarak Alpo köpek maması reklamlarını, şirin, minik köpek yavrularını ve yangın söndürücüleri düşünüyordum. Sanki ölmek üzere değilmişim gibi gülümsemeye çalıştım.
es: Saqué un palo de mi mochila: el poste que había arrancado de la cama de Crusty modelo safari. Lo sostuve en alto, intentando canalizar hacia Cerbero pensamientos perrunos felices: anuncios de exquisiteces para perro, huesos de juguete, piensos apetitosos. Traté de sonreír, como si no estuviera a punto de morir.
vi_translation: I took the big stick out of my backpack. Actually, it was the leg of Crusty's Safari Deluxe bed. While raising the stick, I tried to associate Cerberus with cheerful ideas about dogs: for example, dog food commercials, cute puppies, or fire hydrants. Forcing a smile, I tried to forget that I was about to die.
tr_translation: I took the big stick out of my backpack; I had broken it off from the Luxury Safari model in Kabuklu's shop. Raising the stick in the air, I tried to send happy dog thoughts to Kerberus. I kept thinking about Alpo dog food commercials, cute little puppies, and fire extinguishers. I tried to smile as if I wasn't about to die.
es_translation: I took a stick out of my backpack: the post I had ripped off from Crusty's safari model bed. I held it up high, trying to channel happy dog thoughts towards Cerberus: commercials for dog treats, toy bones, appetizing kibble. I tried to smile, as if I weren't about to die.
st: Ke nkile thupa e kholo ka mokotla oa ka oa mokotla-bethe ke ne ke tlohile mofuta oa mokatong oa Crusty's Safari Deluxe. Ke e tšoere, 'me ka leka ho tsamaisa mehopolo e thabileng ea ntja ho ea khoebong ea Cerberus-Alpo, malinyane a monate, li-hydrants tsa mollo. Ke ile ka leka ho bososela joalo ka ha ke ne ke sa batle ho shoa.
yo: Mo mú ọ̀pá ńlá náà jáde kúrò nínú àpò ẹ̀yìn mi lórí ibùsùn mo ti fọ́ àwòṣe ilẹ̀ Safari Deluxe crusty. Mo gbé e sókè, mo sì gbìyànjú láti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ èrò ajá aláyọ̀ sí ìpolówó Cerberus-Alpo, àwọn ọmọ ajá kékeré tó rẹwà, àwọn hydrants iná. Mo gbìyànjú láti rẹ́rìn-ín, bí ẹni pé mi ò fẹ́ kú.
tn: Ke ne ka ntsha sekurufu se se kuruselang mo sekurufung sa me, ke ne ke tlotse go tswa mo sekgatshing sa me sa mokurukuru. Ke ne ka e tshwara, mme ka leka go dira dilo tse di itumedisang tse di amanang le kgwebo ya Cerberus-Alpo, dijana tse di potlana, di-hydrants tsa molelo. Ke ne ka nyenya e kete ga ke batle go swa.
ty: Ua rave mai au i te raau rahi i rapae i to'u ro'i, e ua parari ta'u matini nira ahu i ni'a i te tahua ha'utiraa a Safari Deluxe. Ua tape'a vau i te reira, e ua tamata vau i te faahaere i te mau mana'o oaoa i ni'a i te mau Cerberus-Alpo, i te tapu i te mau fanau'a puatoro, i te mau pereoo auahi. Ua tamata vau i te ataata, mai te huru ra e, aita vau e pohe ra.
mai: हम अपन बैगसँ पैघ छड़ी निकाललहुँ - एकटा बेडपोस्ट जे हम क्रस्टीक सफारी डीलक्स फ्लोर मॉडलकेँ तोड़ि देने छलहुँ। हम एकरा पकड़ि लेलहुँ, आ कुकुरक प्रसन्न विचारकेँ सेर्बेरस-अल्पो विज्ञापन, प्यारा छोट पिल्ला, फायर हाइड्रेंट दिस प्रवाहित करबाक प्रयास कयलहुँ। हम मुस्कुराए के कोशिश केलहुं, जेना हम मरए वाला नहि छी।
mg: Nalaiko tao amin'ny kitapoko ilay tsora-kazo lehibe iray izay notapahiko tamin'ny modelin'ny gorodona Safari Deluxe an'i Crusty. Nohazoniko ilay izy, ary niezaka ny handefa eritreritra mahafinaritra momba ny alika mankany amin'ny dokam-barotra Cerberus-Alpo, zanak'alika kely mahafatifaty, mpamono afo. en: The line coming from the right side of the judgment pavilion was much better. This one led down toward a small valley surrounded by walls-a gated community, which seemed to be the only happy part of the Underworld. Beyond the security gate were neighborhoods of beautiful houses from every time period in history, Roman villas and medieval castles and Victorian mansions. Silver and gold flowers bloomed on the lawns. The grass rippled in rainbow colors. I could hear laughter and smell barbecue cooking.
en_results: "title": "Percy Jackson and the Olympians: The Last Olympian", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi: Hàng người bên phải lều rạp đỡ khổ hơn nhiều. Người a dẫn họ xuống thung lũng nhỏ có tường bao quanh. Một cộng đồng biệt lập, nơi duy nhất có hạnh phúc dưới âm phủ. Bên kia cổng có lính gác là nhiều quần thể nhà đẹp, đại diện cho mọi lối kiến trúc từng có trong lịch sử: biệt thự kiểu La Mã, lâu đài kiểu trung cổ hoặc dinh thự kiểu Victoria. Hoa bằng vàng và bạc nở rộ trên bãi cỏ có màu của cầu vòng bảy sắc. Tiếng cười văng vẳng và mùi thịt nướng ngoài trời thơm nức.
tr: Karar çadırının sağ tarafından uzayıp giden kuyruk çok daha iyiydi. Bu kuyruk duvarlarla çevrili küçük bir vadiye çıkıyordu. Burada Yeraltı Dünyası'nın tek mutlu topluluğu var gibiydi. Güvenlik kapısının ötesinde, Roma villaları, Ortaçağ şatoları ve Viktorya dönemi malikaneleri gibi değişik tarihi dönemlerden kalma harikulade evlerle dolu mahalleler vardı. Bahçelerde gümüş ve altın rengi çiçekler açmıştı. Çimler gökkuşağı rengindeydi. Kahkahalar duyuluyor, barbekü kokuları geliyordu.
es: La fila que llegaba del lado derecho del pabellón de los juicios era mucho mejor. Esta conducía pendiente abajo hacia un pequeño valle rodeado de murallas: una zona residencial que parecía el único lugar feliz del inframundo. Más allá de la puerta de seguridad había vecindarios de casas preciosas de todas las épocas, desde villas romanas a castillos medievales o mansiones victorianas. Flores de plata y oro lucían en los jardines. La hierba ondeaba con los colores del arco iris. Oí risas y olor a barbacoa.
es_results: "title": "El Libro de la Vida", "author": "Terry Pratchett y Stephen Baxter"
vi_translation: The people on the right side of the tent had it much easier. Person A led them down to a small valley surrounded by walls. An isolated community, the only place with happiness in the underworld. Beyond the gate with guards were many beautiful houses, representing every architectural style ever in history: Roman-style villas, medieval castles, or Victorian mansions. Golden and silver flowers bloomed on the lawns with the colors of a rainbow. Laughter echoed and the smell of outdoor grilled meat was fragrant.
tr_translation: The line extending from the right side of the decision tent was much better. This line led to a small valley surrounded by walls. Here, it seemed like the only happy community of the Underworld existed. Beyond the security gate, there were neighborhoods filled with marvelous houses from various historical periods, such as Roman villas, Medieval castles, and Victorian mansions. Silver and gold-colored flowers had bloomed in the gardens. The lawns were rainbow-colored. Laughter could be heard, and the smell of barbecues was in the air.
es_translation: The line that came from the right side of the judgment pavilion was much better. It led downhill to a small valley surrounded by walls: a residential area that seemed like the only happy place in the underworld. Beyond the security gate, there were neighborhoods with beautiful houses from all eras, from Roman villas to medieval castles or Victorian mansions. Silver and gold flowers shone in the gardens. The grass waved with the colors of the rainbow. I heard laughter and smelled barbecue.
st: Ho tloha ka lehlakoreng le letona la sebaka sa marang-rang ho ne ho le betere haholo. Sena se ile sa lebisa tlase phuleng e nyane e lika-likelitsoeng ke sechaba se nang le marako, se neng se bonahala e le sona feela karolo e thabileng ea Underworld. Ka nģ'ane ho heke ea ts'ireletso e ne e le libaka tsa matlo a matle ho tloha nako le nako nalaneng, matlong a Roma le liqhobosheane tsa mehleng e bohareng le matlo a Victoria. Lipalesa tsa silevera le tsa khauta li thunya ka har'a lifate. ʻO ka hoʻoponopono ʻana o ka ʻae ʻana. Ke ne ke utloa litšeho le ho nkha li-cookie.
yo: Ìlà tí ó ń bọ̀ láti apá ọ̀tún gbọ̀ngàn ìdájọ́ dára púpọ̀. Èyí yọrí sí àfonífojì kékeré kan tí àwọn ògiri yíká, èyí tí ó jọ pé ó jẹ́ apá ayọ̀ kan ṣoṣo nínú Underworld. Lẹ́yìn ẹnu-ọ̀nà ààbò ni àwọn àdúgbò àwọn ilé tó rẹwà láti gbogbo ìgbà nínú ìtàn, àwọn ilé Roman àti àwọn ilé ìgbàanì àti àwọn ilé victorian. Àwọn òdòdó Fàdákà àti wúrà tàn lórí koríko. Koríko náà gbilẹ̀ nínú àwọ̀ rainbow. Mo lè gbọ́ ẹ̀rín kí n sì gbóòórùn ìdáná barbecue.
tn: Go tswa kafa letlhakoreng le le jang la katlholo go ne go le botoka thata. Seno se ne sa dira gore go nne le lefelo le lennye le le neng le okametswe ke motse o o neng o le gaufi le lobota, o o neng o lebega e le lone fela karolo e e itumedisang ya lefatshe. Kwa ntle ga kgoro ya tshireletso go ne go na le matlo a a itumedisang go tswa mo dinakong tsotlhe tsa hisitori, metsana ya Baroma le diholo tsa bogologolo le matlo a ma-Victoria. Dipalesa tsa kgauta le tsa kgauta di ne di thunya ka meedi. Mmala o ne wa fefosa ka mebala e mebe. Ke ne ke kgôna go utlwa go tshega le go apaya
ty: E mea maitai a'e te reni no te pae atau o te haavaraa. Ua arata'i atu teie taata i te hoê peho iti ha'iha'i ma te haatihia e te hoê pŭpŭ taata patu-apî-hia, e au ra o te reira ana'e te tuhaa oaoa no te ao nei. I pihai iho i te uputa parururaa, te vai ra te mau vahi tapiri o te mau fare nehenehe mau mai te mau tau atoa o te aamu, te mau fare no Roma e te mau aorai no te Anotau no Ropu e te mau fare teitei no Victoria. Ua uaa mai te ario e te auro i nia i te matie. Ua î roa te aihere i te mau peni anuanua. Ua nehenehe ia'u ia faaroo i te ata e ia hau'a i te tunu i te maa.
mai: निर्णय मंडपक दहिना कातसँ आबि रहल रेखा बहुत नीक छल। ई दीवारसँ घेरल एकटा छोट घाटी दिस बढ़ल- एकटा द्वारित समुदाय, जे अंडरवर्ल्डक एकमात्र सुखद हिस्सा प्रतीत होइत छल। सुरक्षा द्वारसँ आगू इतिहासक प्रत्येक कालखण्डक सुन्दर घरक पड़ोस, रोमन विला आ मध्यकालीन महल आ विक्टोरियन हवेली छल। लॉन पर चानी आ सोनाक फूल खिलैत छल। घास इंद्रधनुषी रंगमे लहरि रहल छल। हम हँसी आ बारबेक्यू खाना बनाबए के गंध सुनि सकैत छलहुं।
mg: Ny tsipika avy amin'ny ilany ankavanan'ny tranoeva fitsarana dia tsara kokoa. Ity iray ity dia nitondra nidina nankany amin'ny lohasaha kely voahodidin'ny vondrom-piarahamonina misy vavahady, izay toa ny hany ampahany mahafinaritra ao amin'ny tontolo ambanin'ny tany. Ankoatra ny vavahadin'ny fiarovana dia nisy ireo trano tsara tarehy isaky ny vanim-potoana teo amin'ny tantara, trano fonenana romana sy lapa tamin'ny vanim-potoana medieval ary trano fonenana Victoriana. Voninkazo volafotsy sy volamena no mamelana eny amin'ny bozaka. Ny bozaka dia miparitaka amin'ny loko avana. Naheno hehy sy fofona nahandro barbecue aho.

en: The tunnel got darker and colder. The hairs on my arms bristled. It smelled evil down here. It made me think of things I shouldn’t even know about-blood spilled on an ancient stone altar, the foul breath of a murderer.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Đường hầm ngày càng tối và lạnh hơn. Tôi sởn gai ốc. Dưới này có mùi của ma quỷ. Nó gợi nhớ đến những thứ tôi không nên nghĩ tới: máu lênh láng trên mặt bàn thờ đá thời xa xưa và mùi hơi thở hôi thối của kẻ sát nhân.
tr: Tünel gitgide daha da karanlık ve soğuk oldu. Kollarımdaki tüyler ürperiyordu. Burada çok kötü bir hava vardı. Hayatımda daha önce görmediğim birtakım imgeler gözümün önüne geliyordu: eski bir sunağa akıtılmış kanlar, bir katilin leş gibi kokan nefesi...
es: El túnel se volvió aún más oscuro y frío. Se me erizó el vello de los brazos y percibí una horrible fetidez. Me hizo pensar en cosas que ni siquiera había experimentado nunca: sangre derramada en un antiguo altar de piedra, el aliento repulsivo de un asesino.
vi_translation: The tunnel was getting darker and colder. I got goosebumps. Down here, it smelled of evil spirits. It reminded me of things I shouldn't think about: blood spilling over an ancient stone altar and the foul breath of a murderer.
tr_translation: The tunnel became darker and colder. The hairs on my arms were standing up. There was a very bad atmosphere here. Images I had never seen before in my life were coming to my mind: blood spilled on an old altar, the stinking breath of a murderer...
es_translation: The tunnel became even darker and colder. The hair on my arms stood on end, and I perceived a horrible stench. It made me think of things I had never even experienced: blood spilled on an ancient stone altar, the repulsive breath of a murderer.
st: Mohatsela o ne o le lefifi le ho feta. ʻO ka mea hoʻohaʻana a me ka ʻaʻohe. O ile a fumana bobe mona. E entse hore ke nahane ka lintho tseo ke sa lokelang ho li tseba ka mali a tšolotsoeng aletareng ea khale ea majoe, phefumoloho e litšila ea 'molai.
yo: Ojú ọ̀nà náà dúdú sí i ó sì tutù sí i. Irun tí ó wà ní apá mi fọ́. Ò ń run ibi ní ìsàlẹ̀ níbí. Ó jẹ́ kí n ronú nípa àwọn nkan tí mi ò tilẹ̀ gbọ́dọ̀ mọ̀ nípa ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí wọ́n tú sórí pẹpẹ òkúta àtijọ́, èémí burúkú apànìyàn.
tn: 'The tunnel has darker and cold' - Mopo o ne a nna tsididi thata le go feta 'The hairs on my arms' - Dibetsa tsa me di ne di tshwentswe Bosula bo ne bo le mo Ke ne ka simolola go akanya ka dilo tse ke sa tshwanelang go di itse ka madi a a neng a tshologa mo aletareng ya matlapa a bogologolo, e leng moya o o maswe wa mmolai.
ty: Mea poiri a'e e mea toetoe a'e te e'a. Ua paherehia te rouru i ni'a i to'u na rima. Ua hâu'a oia i te ino i ǒ nei. Ua feruri au i te mau mea aita e ti'a ia'u ia ite no ni'a i te toto tei manii i ni'a i te hoê fata ofa'i tahito, te aho ino o te hoê taata taparahi taata.

en: He was yelling, clawing at the ground, but the winged shoes kept dragging him toward the pit, and it didn’t look like we could possibly get to him in time.
en_results: "title": "Percy Jackson and the Lightning Thief", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi: Grover la lối, cào mặt đất nhưng đôi giày nhất định lôi nó xuống vực. Chúng tôi tuyệt vọng vì muốn cứu cũng không kịp nữa.
vi_results: "title": "The Diary of a Young Girl", "author": "Anne Frank"
tr: Kıvırcık çığlık atıyor, yerlere tutunmaya çalışıyor ama ayakkabıları onu dosdoğru uçuruma doğru götürüyordu. Ona zamanında yetişmemiz imkansız gibi gözüküyordu.
es: Gritaba y manoteaba el suelo, pero las zapatillas aladas seguían arrastrándolo hacia el foso, y no parecía que pudiéramos llegar a tiempo.
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra"
vi_translation: Grover screamed and clawed at the ground, but the shoes kept dragging him down the chasm. We were desperate because it was too late to save him.
tr_translation: Curly is screaming, trying to hold onto the ground, but his shoes were taking him straight towards the cliff. It seemed impossible for us to reach him in time.
es_translation: He was shouting and flailing at the ground, but the winged shoes kept dragging him towards the pit, and it didn't seem like we could get there in time.
st: O ne a ntse a lla, a matha fatše, empa lieta tsa mapheo a ne a lula a mo hulela ka sekoting, 'me ha ho bonahale eka re ka khona ho mo fihlela ka nako.

tn: O ne a lela, a lela fa fatshe, mme setlhako sa gagwe se ne sa mo isa kwa sedibeng, mme ga se ka ga bonala fa re ka fitlha kwa go ene ka nako.

en: Up close, I saw that the engravings on the gates were scenes of death. Some were from modern times-an atomic bomb exploding over a city, a trench filled with gas mask-wearing soldiers, a line of African famine victims waiting with empty bowls-but all of them looked as if they’d been etched into the bronze thousands of years ago. I wondered if I was looking at prophecies that had come true.
vi: Đến gần hơn, tôi nhận thấy trên cổng khắc chạm toàn cảnh chết chóc. Có cảnh thời hiện đại, như bom nguyên tử thổi bay cả thành phố, sông ngòi đầy xác lính đeo mặt nạ chống độc, đoàn người Phi châu sắp chết đói cầm tô xếp hàng chờ phát chẩn… Mọi cảnh minh họa đều cổ kính, nhất định được khắc lên đó cả ngàn năm rồi. Chúng là lời tiên tri của nhiều ngàn năm trước giờ trở thành hiện thực.
tr: Yakından bakınca kapıların üzerindeki oymaların çeşitli ölüm sahnelerini yansıttığını gördüm. Bazıları günümüzdendi; mesela, bir şehrin üzerinde patlayan bir atom bombasını, gaz maskesi takmış askerleri, ellerinde bomboş yemek kaplarıyla sırada bekleyen aç Afrikalıları gösterenoymalar vardı. Ama hepsi de bu bronz kapılara sanki asırlar önce kazınmış gibiydi. Bunların gerçekleşen kehanetler olup olmadıklarını merak ettim bir an.
es: Cuando estuve más cerca, aprecié que los grabados de dichas puertas reproducían escenas de muerte. Algunas eran de tiempos modernos —una bomba atómica explotando encima de una ciudad, una trinchera llena de soldados con máscaras antigás, una fila de víctimas de hambrunas africanas, esperando con cuencos vacíos en la mano—, pero todas parecían labradas en bronce hacía miles de años. Me pregunté si eran profecías hechas realidad.
vi_translation: Getting closer, I noticed the gate was carved with scenes of death. There were scenes of modern times, like an atomic bomb blowing up an entire city, rivers filled with the bodies of soldiers wearing gas masks, lines of starving African people holding bowls, waiting for food distribution... All the illustrations were ancient, definitely carved there thousands of years ago. They were prophecies from many thousands of years ago that have now become reality.
tr_translation: When I looked closely, I saw that the carvings on the doors depicted various scenes of death. Some were from our time; for example, there were carvings showing an atomic bomb exploding over a city, soldiers wearing gas masks, and starving Africans waiting in line with empty food containers in their hands. But they all seemed to have been etched onto these bronze doors centuries ago. I wondered for a moment if these were prophecies that had come true.
es_translation: When I got closer, I noticed that the engravings on those gates depicted scenes of death. Some were from modern times —an atomic bomb exploding over a city, a trench full of soldiers wearing gas masks, a line of famine victims in Africa, waiting with empty bowls in hand—, but all seemed to have been carved in bronze thousands of years ago. I wondered if they were prophecies come true.
st: Ha ke fihla moo, ke ile ka bona hore li-fats'a liheke li ne li le teng ka lebaka la lefu. Ba bang ba ne ba tsoa mehleng ea kajeno bomo ea atomiki e phatlohile ka mose ho toropo, trench e tletseng masole a apereng mask, mohala oa bahlaseluoa ba tlala ba Afrika ba emetseng likotlolo tse se nang letho- empa kaofela ha bona ba ne ba shebahala eka ba ne ba ts'oeroe ka boronse lilemong tse likete tse fetileng. Ke ile ka ipotsa hore na ebe ke ile ka sheba boprofeta bo neng bo phethahala.
yo: Ní ìparí, mo rí i pé àwọn àwòrán tí ó wà ní ẹnubodè jẹ́ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ikú. Àwọn kan wá láti ìgbà òde òní-bọ́bù atomiki tí ó ń bú jáde lórí ìlú kan, ọgbà tí ó kún fún àwọn ọmọ-ogun tí wọ́n wọ ìbòjú gáàsì, ìlà àwọn tí ìyàn ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ ń dúró pẹ̀lú àwọn abọ́ òfìfo - ṣùgbọ́n gbogbo wọn dàbí ẹni pé wọ́n ti fi wọ́n sínú idẹ ní ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún ọdún sẹ́yìn. Mo ń rò ó bóyá mò ń wo àwọn àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ tó ti ṣẹ.
tn: Ke ne ka bona gore mo mejakong e e mo dikgorong e ne e le tsa loso. Bangwe ba ne ba tswa mo metlheng ya segompieno - bomo ya atomo e ne e thubega mo motseng, lo lole lo lo tletseng masole a a apereng ditlhase, mola wa batswasetlhabelo ba leuba la Aforika ba ba emetseng megotswana e e se nang sepe- mme botlhe ba lebega jaaka e kete ba ne ba thusitswe mo boronseng dingwaga di le dikete tse di fetileng. Ke ne ka ipotsa gore a ke ne ke lebelela dipolelelopele tse di neng di direga.
ty: I pihai iho, ua ite atura vau e te mau hoho'a i nana'ohia i nia i te mau uputa, e mau hoho'a ïa o te pohe. No roto mai te tahi i te hoê paura atomi no teie tau i ni'a i te hoê oire, te hoê apoo tei î i te mau fa'ehau tei tapo'ihia i te mata, te hoê reni o te mau taata tei roohia i te o'e no Afirika e te mau au'a aita e taata to roto, tera râ, mai te mea ra e, ua patiahia ratou i roto i te veo e rave rahi tauatini matahiti i ma'iri a'e nei. Ua feruri au e, te hi'o ra anei au i te mau parau tohu tei tupu.
mai: लगसँ हम देखलहुँ जे फाटक पर उत्कीर्णन मृत्युक दृश्य छल। किछु आधुनिक समयक छल - कोनो शहरक ऊपर विस्फोट भऽ रहल परमाणु बम, गैस मास्क पहिरने सैनिकसँ भरल एकटा खाई, अफ्रीकी अकाल पीड़ितक एकटा पंक्ति खाली कटोरा लऽ कऽ प्रतीक्षा कऽ रहल छल - मुदा ई सभ एहन लगैत छल जेना ओ हजारो साल पहिने कांस्यमे उकेरि गेल हो। हम सोचलहुं जे की हम ओहि भविष्यवाणीकेँ देखि रहल छी जे सत्य भऽ गेल छल।
mg: Teo akaiky teo dia hitako fa ny sary sokitra teo amin'ny vavahady dia sarin'ny fahafatesana. Ny sasany dia avy amin'ny vanim-potoana maoderina - baomba atomika mipoaka manerana ny tanàna iray, lavaka kely feno miaramila manao saron-tava amin'ny entona, andian'ireo Afrikana niharan'ny mosary miandry vilia tsy misy na inona na inona - saingy izy rehetra ireo dia toy ny hoe voasokitra tao anatin'ny alimo an'arivony taona lasa izay. Nanontany tena aho raha toa ka nijery ireo faminaniana izay efa tanteraka.

en: Two U.S. Marine skeletons guarded the doors. They grinned down at us, rocket-propelled grenade launchers held across their chests.
vi: Hai bộ xương mặc đồ lính thủy đánh bộ Mỹ canh cửa này. Thấy tôi họ nhăn nhở cười, tay vẫn ghì súng phóng lựu đạn trước ngực.
tr: Kapıların önünde iki ABD'li denizci iskeleti bekliyordu. Bize bakıp sırıttılar. Göğüslerine roketle fırlatılan el bombaları asmışlardı.
tr_results: "title": "The Old Man and the Sea", "author": "Ernest Hemingway"
es: Dos esqueletos con uniforme de marine custodiaban las puertas. Nos sonrieron. Tenían lanzagranadas automáticos cruzados sobre el pecho.
vi_translation: Two skeletons dressed in U.S. Marine uniforms guard this door. Seeing me, they grinned broadly, their hands still gripping grenade launchers against their chests.
tr_translation: In front of the doors, two skeletons of American sailors were waiting. They looked at us and grinned. They had grenades launched by rockets hanging on their chests.
es_translation: Two skeletons in marine uniforms guarded the doors. They smiled at us. They had automatic grenade launchers crossed over their chests.
st: Li-skeletons tse peli tsa Us li ile tsa sireletsa mamati. Ba ile ba re beha ka har'a li-rocket-propelled, li-rocket-propelled li-grenades tse neng li tšoaretsoe ka har'a lifuba tsa bona.
yo: Àwọn egungun òkun U.S. méjì ṣọ́ ilẹ̀kùn. Wọ́n rẹ́rìn-ín sí wa, àwọn ohun èlò ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ìbọn olóró tí wọ́n gbé sórí àyà wọn.

en: The throne room shook with a tremor so strong, they probably felt it upstairs in Los Angeles. Debris fell from the cavern ceiling. Doors burst open all along the walls, and skeletal warriors marched in, hundreds of them, from every time period and nation in Western civilization. They lined the perimeter of the room, blocking the exits.
vi: Căn phòng rung chuyển như thể sắp làm cả Los Angeles phía trên đổ sụp. Gạch đá từ trần hang rơi như mưa. Mọi cửa chính phụ ở bốn bức tường bật mở. Hàng trăm bộ xương lính canh mặc quân phục của mọi quốc gia thuộc nền văn minh phương tây rầm rập bước vào. Họ đứng thành hàng quây quanh phòng, chắn mọi lối ra.
tr: Taht odası öyle şiddetle sallandı ki, eminim Los Angeles bile sarsılmıştı. Mağaranın tavanından bir şeyler döküldü. Duvarlardaki kapıların hepsi açıldı ve bütün tarihi zamanlardan ve Batı medeniyetinden yüzlerce iskelet savaşçı içeri girdi. Odanın tam ortasında sıralanarak bütün çıkışları kapattılar.
es: El salón del trono se sacudió con un temblor tan fuerte que probablemente lo notaron en Los Angeles. Cayeron escombros del techo de la caverna. Las puertas se abrieron de golpe en todos los muros, y los guerreros esqueléticos entraron, docenas de ellos, de todas las épocas y naciones de la civilización occidental. Formaron en el perímetro de la sala, bloqueando las salidas.
vi_translation: The room shook as if it was about to bring down all of Los Angeles above. Bricks and stones fell from the cave ceiling like rain. All the main and side doors on the four walls burst open. Hundreds of skeleton guards in uniforms of every nation from Western civilization marched in. They stood in rows surrounding the room, blocking all exits.
tr_translation: The throne room shook so violently that I'm sure even Los Angeles felt it. Something fell from the ceiling of the cave. All the doors in the walls opened, and hundreds of skeletal warriors from all historical periods and Western civilization entered. They lined up in the middle of the room, blocking all the exits.
es_translation: The throne room shook with a tremor so strong that it was probably felt in Los Angeles. Debris fell from the cavern's ceiling. The doors burst open on all the walls, and skeletal warriors entered, dozens of them, from all eras and nations of Western civilization. They formed a perimeter around the room, blocking the exits.
st: Ba ile ba ikutloa ba e-na le matla a maholo haholo, mohlomong ba ile ba ikutloa ba le holimo Los Angeles. Lithōle li ile tsa oela ka ho tloha marulelong a cavern. Menyako e ile ea phatloha hohle marakong, 'me bahlabani ba skeletal ba ile ba tsamaea ka, makholo a bona, ho tloha linakong tsohle le sechaba ka tsoelo-pele ea Bophirimela. Ka mor'a moo, ba ile ba khaola ka kamoreng ea ho hlapela, ba thibela ho tsoa.
yo: Yàrá ìtẹ́ náà gbọ̀n pẹ̀lú ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára, ó ṣe é ṣe kí wọ́n ní ìmọ̀lára rẹ̀ lókè ní Los Angeles. Ìdọ̀tí ṣubú láti orí àjà ihò. Àwọn ilẹ̀kùn ṣí sílẹ̀ ní gbogbo ògiri, àwọn jagunjagun egungun sì wọlé, ọgọ́rọ̀ọ̀rún wọn, láti gbogbo ìgbà àti orílẹ̀-èdè ní ọ̀làjú Ìwọ̀ Oòrùn. Wọ́n wà ní ìlà agbègbè yàrá náà, wọ́n ń dí àwọn ọ̀nà àbájáde.

en: From his pocket he took out a ski cap-the kind bank robbers wear-and placed it between the handlebars of his bike. Immediately, the cap transformed into an elaborate bronze war helmet.
vi: Ông ta lấy mũ lưỡi trai trong túi móc lên tay ga của xe mô tô. đây là loại mũ trùm kín mặt, chỉ chừa hai mắt bọn cướp ngân hàng thường đội. Nó lập tức biến thành mũ đồng trang trí cầu kỳ của lính Hy Lạp cổ.
tr: Cebinden, aynı soyguncuların giydiği gibi bir kasket çıkardı ve bunu motosikletinin tutacaklarının arasına koydu. Kasket, anında gösterişli, bronz bir savaş miğferine dönüştü.
es: —Se sacó del bolsillo un pasamontañas, del tipo que usan los atracadores de bancos, y lo colocó en medio del manillar de su moto, donde se transformó en un elaborado casco guerrero de bronce.
vi_translation: He took a baseball cap from his pocket and hooked it onto the throttle of the motorcycle. This type of cap covered the entire face, leaving only the eyes exposed, similar to what bank robbers often wore. It immediately transformed into an elaborately decorated helmet of ancient Greek soldiers.
tr_translation: He took a cap out of his pocket, just like the ones the robbers wore, and placed it between the handles of his motorcycle. The cap instantly transformed into a flashy, bronze war helmet.
es_translation: —He took a balaclava out of his pocket, the kind bank robbers use, and placed it in the middle of his motorcycle's handlebar, where it transformed into an elaborate bronze warrior helmet.

en: “That’s cool, dead boy,” he said. “Classic it is.” The baseball bat changed into a huge, two-handed sword. The hilt was a large silver skull with a ruby in its mouth.
vi: - Hay lắm. Vậy cổ điển nhé. Gậy bóng chày biến thành gươm hai lưỡi cỡ lớn. Chuôi kiếm bạc hình đầu lâu ngậm hồng ngọc lấp lánh.
tr: "Peki o zaman, ölü çocuk," dedi. "Klasik olsun." Beyzbol sopası, kocaman, ancak iki elle tutulabilen bir kılıca dönüştü. Kılıcın kabzası, ağzında bir yakut tutan kocaman bir kurukafaydı.
es: —Para estar muerto tienes mucha gracia —contestó—. Probemos con el clásico. Entonces el bate se convirtió en una enorme espada cuya empuñadura era un cráneo de plata con un rubí en la boca.

vi_translation: - Very good. So, classical then. The baseball bat transformed into a large double-edged sword. The silver sword hilt was shaped like a skull holding a sparkling ruby.
tr_translation: "Well then, dead child," he said. "Let it be classic." The baseball bat turned into a huge sword that could only be held with two hands. The hilt of the sword was a large skull holding a ruby in its mouth.
es_translation: —For being dead, you have a lot of charm —he replied—. Let's try with the classic. Then the bat turned into a huge sword with a silver skull hilt and a ruby in its mouth.

en: I couldn’t look away from Ares for fear he’d slice me in half, but out of the corner of my eye I saw red lights flashing on the shoreline boulevard. Car doors were slamming.
vi: Nếu ngoái đầu nhìn, chắc chắn Ares xé đôi người tôi ngay. Tôi liếc ngang thấy ngoài lộ đèn đỏ loang loáng. Có tiếng sập cửa xe rầm rầm.
tr: Derken, gözlerimin ucuyla kıyıya yakın caddede kırmızı ışıkların yanıp söndüğünü gördüm. Araba kapıları çarpıyordu.
es: No dejé de mirar a Ares por miedo a que me partiera en dos, pero con el rabillo del ojo vi luces rojas parpadear en el paseo marítimo. Se oyeron frenazos y portezuelas de coche.
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra"
vi_translation: If I looked back, Ares would definitely tear me in half. I glanced sideways and saw the red lights flashing on the road. There was the sound of car doors slamming loudly.
tr_translation: Then, out of the corner of my eye, I saw red lights flashing on the street near the shore. Car doors were slamming.
es_translation: I didn't stop watching Ares for fear that he would split me in two, but out of the corner of my eye, I saw red lights flashing on the boardwalk. There were screeching brakes and car doors slamming.
st: Ke ne ke sitoa ho sheba hole le Ares bakeng sa tšabo o ne a tla ntšoa ka halofo, empa ho tsoa sekhutlong sa leihlo la ka ke ile ka bona mabone a khubelu a phatsimang lebopong la leoatle la boulevard. Likoloi tsa koloi li ne li koetsoe.
yo: Mi ò lè wo Ares nítorí ìbẹ̀rù pé yóò gé mi sí ìdajì, ṣùgbọ́n láti igun ojú mi mo rí iná pupa tí ó ń tàn ní etíkun boulevard. Àwọn ilẹ̀kùn ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ ń lu.
tn: Ke ne ke sa kgone go itse gore o ne a tshaba gore o ne a ntshosa ka fa tlase ga matlho a me, mme ke ne ka bona dipone tse dihibidu tse di phatsimang mo lebopong la lewatle. Dikoloi tse di neng di le teng di ne di sa ntse di le mo kotsing.
ty: Aita i nehenehe ia'u ia hi'o atu i rapae au i te fare pureraa no to'u ri'ari'a e ia tâpû oia ia'u i te afaraa, i rapae râ i te poro o to'u mata ua ite au i te mau mori uteute i te anaanaraa i ni'a i te poro mou'a. Ua paapaa roa te mau opani pereoo.

en: It was as if a cloud covered the sun, but worse. Light faded. Sound and color drained away. A cold, heavy presence passed over the beach, slowing time, dropping the temperature to freezing, and making me feel like life was hopeless, fighting was useless.
vi: Lúc đầu tôi tưởng mây che mặt trời nhưng không phải. Ánh sáng nhạt dần. Âm thanh, màu sắc kém hẳn. Có cái gì nặng nề, lạnh lẽo phủ trên bờ cát. Thời gian như ngừng trôi, nhiệt độ tụt xuống điểm đóng băng khiến tôi tràn ngập cảm giác đời tuyệt vọng, ý chí đấu tranh bị bẻ gãy.
tr: Sanki bir bulut güneşin önüne geçmiş gibiydi ama daha da kötüydü. Işık bir an söndü. Sesler ve renkler kayboldu. Soğuk, ağır bir basınç plajın üzerinden geçerek, zamanı yavaşlattı; ısı dondurucu bir soğuğa dönüştü. Sanki hayatın bir anlamı kalmamıştı, savaşmak bile nafile gibiydi.
es: Fue como si una nube ocultase el sol, pero peor. La luz se desvaneció, el sonido y el color se amortiguaron, y entonces una presencia fría y pesada cruzó la playa, ralentizando el tiempo y bajando la temperatura abruptamente. Me recorrió un escalofrío y sentí que en la vida no había esperanza, que luchar era inútil.
vi_translation: At first, I thought the clouds were covering the sun, but that wasn't the case. The light gradually faded. Sounds and colors diminished significantly. There was something heavy and cold covering the sandy shore. Time seemed to stop, the temperature dropped to freezing point, filling me with a sense of hopelessness, and my will to fight was broken.
tr_translation: It was as if a cloud had passed in front of the sun, but it was even worse. The light went out for a moment. Sounds and colors disappeared. A cold, heavy pressure passed over the beach, slowing down time; the heat turned into a freezing cold. It was as if life had lost its meaning, even fighting seemed futile.
es_translation: It was as if a cloud had obscured the sun, but worse. The light faded, sound and color dampened, and then a cold, heavy presence crossed the beach, slowing time and abruptly lowering the temperature. A shiver ran through me and I felt that in life there was no hope, that fighting was useless.
st: E ne e le joalokaha eka leru le koahetse letsatsi, empa ho hobe le ho feta. Leseli le ile la hloleha. Molumo le 'mala o tlosoa. Boteng bo batang, bo boima bo fetile lebopong, nako e liehang, ho theola mocheso ho bata, mme ho etsa hore ke utloe eka bophelo bo ne bo se na tšepo, ho loana ho ne ho se na thuso.
yo: Ó dà bí ẹni pé àwọsánmọ̀ bo oòrùn, ṣùgbọ́n ó burú jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ. Iná ti parẹ́. Ohùn àti àwọ̀ ti gbẹ dànù. Òtútù, wíwà tó wúwo kọjá ní etí òkun, àkókò díẹ̀díẹ̀, ó ń dín ìwọ̀n òtútù kù sí òtútù, ó sì ń jẹ́ kí n ní ìmọ̀lára pé ìgbésí ayé kò ní ìrètí, ìjà kò wúlò.

en: She cackled, savoring the idea. Then she and her sisters rose on their bats’ wings, fluttered into the smoke-filled sky, and disappeared.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Bà ta cười khùng khục như thế tự tán thưởng câu nói thâm thúy vừa rồi. Sau đó, bà ta dang cánh bay lên bầu trời mịt mờ tối và khuất dạng.
tr: Eline düştüğüm düşüncesi onu zevklendirince şöyle biröttü. Sonra kız kardeşleriyle birlikte yarasa kanatlarının üzerinde kalkıp dumanla kaplanmış gökyüzüne kanat çırptılar ve gözden kayboldular.

es: Estalló en carcajadas, saboreando la idea. Después las tres hermanas levantaron el vuelo hacia un cielo lleno de humo y desaparecieron.
vi_translation: She chuckled as if to self-congratulate for the profound statement just made. Then, she spread her wings and flew into the dark, obscure sky and disappeared.
tr_translation: The thought of falling into his hands delighted him, so he let out a chirp. Then, together with his sisters, he rose on bat wings, flapped into the smoke-covered sky, and disappeared from sight.
es_translation: He burst into laughter, savoring the idea. Then the three sisters took flight towards a smoke-filled sky and disappeared.

es: Fueron los periodistas quienes nos proporcionaron la historia. Nosotros nos limitamos a asentir, llorosos y cansados (lo cual no fue difícil), y representamos los papeles de víctimas ante las cámaras.
vi_translation: The journalists make up stories for us. We just need to act sad and tired (at this time, pretending like that isn't too difficult) and play the role of children in distress in front of the camera, and that's it. I pretended to choke up in front of the camera:
tr_translation: The journalists told us the whole story in this way. We listened to them, nodding our heads, and shedding a few tears. Meanwhile, we were complaining about being tired, which was not difficult at all. We were playing the victim role in front of the cameras.
es_translation: It was the journalists who provided us with the story. We simply nodded, tearful and tired (which was not difficult), and played the roles of victims in front of the cameras.

en: I was standing on a narrow stone walkway in the middle of the air. Below me was Manhattan, from the height of an airplane. In front of me, white marble steps wound up the spine of a cloud, into the sky. My eyes followed the stairway to its end, where my brain just could not accept what I saw.
en_results: "title": "The Particular Sadness of Lemon Cake", "author": "Aimee Bender"
vi: Dưới chân tôi chỉ có hòn đá nhỏ lơ lửng giữa trời. Manhattan phía dưới cách tôi một khoảng bằng từ chiều cao của máy bay xuống mặt đất. Trước mặt tôi, đá hoa cương xếp trên viền đám mây xốp, dẫn lên trời. Mắt tôi lần theo từng bậc thang, đến chỗ não bộ không chịu chấp nhận.
vi_results: "title": "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao", "author": "Junot Diaz"
tr: Boşlukta asılı duran, dar bir taş geçidin üzerindeydim. Manhattan'a bir uçak yüksekliğinden bakıyordum. Önümde uzanan beyaz mermer merdivenler gökyüzündeki bir bulutun içine doğru devam ediyordu. Gözlerimle merdivenlerin nerede sona erdiğini takip ettim ama gördüğüm şeyi aklım almıyordu.
es: Estaba de pie sobre una pequeña pasarela de piedra en medio del vacío. Debajo tenía Manhattan, a altura de avión. Delante, unos escalones de mármol serpenteaban alrededor de una nube hasta el cielo. Mis ojos siguieron la escalera hasta el final, y entonces no di crédito a lo que vi.
vi_translation: Below my feet, there was only a small rock floating in the sky. Manhattan below was as far from me as the height from an airplane to the ground. In front of me, granite stones arranged on the edge of the fluffy cloud, leading up to the sky. My eyes followed each step, to the point where the brain refused to accept.
tr_translation: I was on a narrow stone passage suspended in the void. I was looking at Manhattan from the height of an airplane. The white marble stairs stretching out before me continued into a cloud in the sky. I followed the stairs with my eyes to see where they ended, but my mind couldn't comprehend what I saw.
es_translation: He was standing on a small stone walkway in the middle of the void. Below him was Manhattan, at airplane height. In front, some marble steps wound around a cloud up to the sky. My eyes followed the staircase to the end, and then I couldn't believe what I saw.
st: Ke ne ke eme holim'a tsela e moqotetsane oa majoe bohareng ba moea. Ka tlase ke ne ke manhattan, ho tloha bophahamong ba sefofane. Ka pel'a ka, mehato e tšoeu ea 'mabole e ile ea etsa hore mokokotlo oa leru, o kene leholimong. Mahlo a ka a latetse litepisi ho ea qetellong ea eona, moo boko ba ka bo neng bo sa khone ho amohela seo ke se boneng.
yo: Mo dúró lórí ọ̀nà ìrìn òkúta tó tóbi ní àárín afẹ́fẹ́. Ní ìsàlẹ̀ mi ni Manhattan wà, láti ibi gíga ọkọ̀ òfurufú. Níwájú mi, àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ òkúta òkúta funfun parí ẹ̀yìn àwọsánmọ̀, sí ọ̀run. Ojú mi tẹ̀lé àtẹ̀gùn títí dé òpin rẹ̀, níbi tí ọpọlọ mi kò ti lè gba ohun tí mo rí.
tn: Ke ne ke eme fa gare ga leje le lennye. Fa tlase ga me e ne e le Manhattan, go tswa kwa bogodimong jwa sefofane. en: Room really isn’t the right word. The place made Grand Central Station look like a broom closet. Massive columns rose to a domed ceiling, which was gilded with moving constellations.
vi: Gọi là phòng không hẳn đúng. So với nó, nhà ga trung tâm New York giống tủ cất chổi và giẻ lau nhà. Cột lớn vươn tận mái vòm điểm xuyến bằng những chòm sao.
tr: Aslında oda pek de doğru kelime değildi. Oranın yanında, Grand Central İstasyonu kiler gibi kalırdı. Kocaman sütunlar, hareket halindeki yıldızları gösteren kavisli bir tavana kadar uzanıyordu.
es: «Sala» no es exactamente la palabra adecuada. Aquel lugar hacía que la estación Grand Central de Nueva York pareciera un armario para escobas. Columnas descomunales se alzaban hasta un techo abovedado, en el que se desplazaban las constelaciones de oro.

vi_translation: Calling it a room is not entirely accurate. Compared to it, Grand Central Terminal in New York looks like a broom and mop closet. Large columns reach up to the dome adorned with constellations.
tr_translation: Actually, room wasn't quite the right word. Next to that place, Grand Central Station would seem like a pantry. Huge columns extended up to a curved ceiling that showed stars in motion.
es_translation: “Room” is not exactly the right word. That place made New York's Grand Central Station look like a broom closet. Colossal columns rose up to a vaulted ceiling, where golden constellations moved.

en: I took one last look around my bedroom. I had a feeling I’d never see it again. Then I walked with my mother to the front door.
en_results: "title": "The Diary of a Young Girl", "author": "Anne Frank"
vi: Nhìn quanh phòng lần cuối, tôi linh cảm sẽ không bao giờ quay lại nơi này. Lát sau tôi theo mẹ ra cửa.
tr: Odama son bir kez dönüp baktım. İçimde burayı son kez görüyormuşum gibi bir his vardı. Sonra annemle birlikte sokak kapısına yürüdük.
es: Volví a mirar mi habitación e intuí que ya no volvería a verla. Después fui con mi madre hasta la puerta principal.
vi_translation: Looking around the room one last time, I had a feeling I would never return to this place. A moment later, I followed my mother out the door.
tr_translation: I turned around and looked one last time. I had a feeling inside as if I were seeing this place for the last time. Then my mother and I walked to the street door.
es_translation: I looked back at my room and sensed that I would never see it again. Then I went with my mother to the front door.

en: On a completely unrelated subject, she’d sold her first life-size concrete sculpture, entitled The Poker Player, to a collector, through an art gallery in Soho. She’d gotten so much money for it, she’d put a deposit down on a new apartment and made a payment on her first semester’s tuition at NYU. The Soho gallery was clamoring for more of her work, which they called “a huge step forward in super-ugly neorealism.”
vi: Chuyển sang chuyện khác, mẹ bảo bà vừa bán quần thể tượng đầu tay to bằng người thật cho phòng trưng bày ở Soho. Tác phẩm của mẹ có tên: Xới bạc. Tiền thù lao nhiều đến nổi mẹ đủ tiền mua căn hộ mới và đóng tiền học năm đầu tại đại học New York. Phòng trưng bày Soho nài nỉ mẹ tạc thêm tượng mới.
tr: Ha, bir de annem ilk heykelini satmış. Bu gerçek insan boyutlarında, Pokerci adını verdiği bir çalışmaymış. Heykeli, Soho'da bir sanat galerisi olan bir koleksiyoncu satın almış. Annem heykelden o kadar çok para kazanmış ki, yeni bir daire almak için paranın bir kısmını depozito olarak vermiş ve New York Üniversitesi'nde eğitimine devam edebilmek için ilk dönemin harcını yatırmış. Soho'daki sanat galerisi, annemin çalışmasını "süper çirkin neorealite akımının" öncülüğünü yapan bir eser olarak tanımlamış ve ondan yeni çalışmalar bekliyormuş.
es: En otro orden de cosas, mamá acababa de vender su primera escultura de hormigón tamaño natural, titulada El jugador de póquer, a un coleccionista a través de una galería de arte del Soho. Había obtenido tanto dinero que había pagado la fianza para un piso nuevo y la matrícula del primer semestre en la Universidad de Nueva York. La galería del Soho le había pedido más esculturas, que definían como «un gran paso hacia el neorrealismo superfeo».
es_results: "title": "The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao", "author": "Junot Díaz"
vi_translation: Moving on to another story, mom said she just sold her first life-sized sculpture to a gallery in Soho. Mom's work is titled: Silver Plow. The payment was so substantial that mom had enough money to buy a new apartment and pay for the first year at New York University. The Soho gallery begged mom to sculpt more statues.
tr_translation: Oh, and my mom sold her first sculpture. It was a life-sized piece she called Poker Player. A collector who owns an art gallery in Soho bought the sculpture. My mother made so much money from the sculpture that she used part of it as a deposit to buy a new apartment and paid the first semester's tuition to continue her education at New York University. The art gallery in Soho described my mother's work as a piece pioneering the "super ugly neorealism movement" and was expecting new works from her.
es_translation: In other news, Mom had just sold her first life-size concrete sculpture, titled The Poker Player, to a collector through an art gallery in Soho. She had made so much money that she paid the deposit for a new apartment and the tuition for the first semester at New York University. The Soho gallery had asked for more sculptures, which they described as "a big step towards super-ugly neorealism."
st: Ka taba e sa amaneng le letho, o ile a rekisa setšoantšo sa hae sa pele sa konkreite sa bophelo, se bitsoang The Poker Player, ho mokelli, ka gallery ea bonono Soho. O ile a fumana chelete e ngata haholo bakeng sa eona, o ile a beha depositi fatše ka foleteng e ncha 'me a lefa ka thuto ea hae ea pele ea semesters ho NYU. The Soho gallery e ne e clamoring bakeng sa mosebetsi oa hae o mongata, oo ba o bitsitseng "mohato o moholo pele ho neorealism e mpe haholo."
yo: Lórí ọ̀rọ̀ tí kò níí ṣe pẹ̀lú rẹ̀ pátápátá, ó ti ta ère kọ́kọ́rẹ́ẹ̀tì ìwọ̀n ìgbésí ayé àkọ́kọ́ rẹ̀, tí àkọlé rẹ̀ jẹ́ The Poker Player, fún olùkójọpọ̀, nípasẹ̀ àwòrán ọnà ní Soho. Ó ti gba owó púpọ̀ fún un, yóò fi owó ìfipamọ́ sí ilé tuntun ó sì san owó lórí owó ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ sáà àkọ́kọ́ rẹ̀ ní NYU. Ilé ìṣàfihàn Soho ń kígbe fún iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ púpọ̀ sí i, èyí tí wọ́n pè ní "ìgbésẹ̀ ńlá síwájú nínú neorealism tí kò dára."

O ne a dira tiro ya gagwe e ntsi e e neng e le mo go yone e e neng e le ya go nna le seabe mo go oketsegileng, e ba neng ba e bitsa "kgato e kgolo thata ya go nna le seabe mo go feteletseng."

mai: एकटा पूर्ण रूपसँ असंबंधित विषय पर, ओ सोहोक एकटा आर्ट गैलरीक माध्यमसँ अपन पहिल आदमकद कंक्रीटक मूर्ति, द पोकर प्लेयर नामक एकटा कलेक्टरकेँ बेचि देने छलीह। हुनका एकरा लेल एतेक पाइ भेटल छलनि, ओ एकटा नव अपार्टमेंटमे जमा कऽ एनवाईयूमे अपन पहिल सेमेस्टरक ट्यूशनक भुगतान करैत छलीह। सोहो गैलरी हुनकर बेसी काजक लेल चिल्ला रहल छल, जकरा ओ "अति-बदसूरत नवयथार्थवादमे एकटा पैघ डेग" कहलनि।

en: If you intend to stay at Camp Half-Blood year-round, you must inform the Big House by noon today. If you do not announce your intentions, we will assume you have vacated your cabin or died a horrible death. Cleaning harpies will begin work at sundown. They will be authorized to eat any unregistered campers. All personal articles left behind will be incinerated in the lava pit.
en_results: "title": "Percy Jackson and the Olympians: The Lightning Thief", "author": "Rick Riordan"
vi: Nếu định ở trại quanh năm, bạn phải báo cáo cho Nhà Lớn trước mười hai giờ trưa nay. Nếu không báo, chúng tôi sẽ cho rằng bạn đã rời nhà hoặc chết bi thảm. Khi mặt trời lặn, nhóm yêu quái mình người cánh chim có nhiệm vụ dọn dẹp và sẽ bắt đầu công việc đó. Họ có quyền ăn thịt trại viên chưa đăng ký. Mọi vật dụng cá nhân bỏ quên sẽ bị hỏa táng ở hố nham thạch.
tr: Eğer bütün sene boyunca Melez Kampı'nda kalmayı düşünüyorsanız bugün öğleye kadar Büyük Ev'e haber vermeniz gerekmektedir. Eğer kararınızı bildirmezseniz, kulübenizi boşalttığınız veya korkunç bir biçimde öldüğünüz sonucuna varılacaktır. Temizlikçi harpyalar günbatımında işe koyulacaklardır. Kampta izinsiz kalan kampçıları yemek için kendilerine izin verilmiştir. Tüm şahsi eşyalar lav uçurumunda yakılacaktır.
es: Si tienes intención de quedarte en el Campamento Mestizo todo el año, debes notificarlo a la Casa Grande antes de mediodía de hoy. Si no anuncias tus intenciones, asumiremos que has dejado libre la cabaña o has muerto víctima de un final horrible. Las arpías de la limpieza empezarán a trabajar al atardecer. Tienen permiso para comerse a cualquier campista no autorizado. Todos los artículos personales que olvidéis serán incinerados en el foso de lava.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el cáliz de fuego", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: If you intend to stay at the camp year-round, you must report to the Main House before twelve noon today. If you do not report, we will assume that you have either left home or died tragically. When the sun sets, the group of demon bird-men responsible for cleaning will begin their work. They have the right to eat any campers who have not registered. All personal belongings left behind will be cremated in the lava pit.
tr_translation: If you plan to stay at Camp Half-Blood for the entire year, you must inform the Big House by noon today. If you do not report your decision, it will be assumed that you have vacated your cabin or met a terrible fate. The cleaning harpies will start their work at sunset. They are permitted to eat campers who remain in the camp without authorization. All personal belongings will be burned in the lava pit.
es_translation: If you intend to stay at Camp Half-Blood all year, you must notify the Big House before noon today. If you do not announce your intentions, we will assume you have vacated the cabin or met a horrible end. The cleaning harpies will start working at dusk. They have permission to eat any unauthorized camper. All personal items you forget will be incinerated in the lava pit.
st: Haeba u batla ho lula kampong halofo ea mali selemo ho pota, u tlameha ho tsebisa Ntlo e Kholo ka thapama. Haeba u sa batle ho etsa joalo, re tla nahana hore u se u file file file ea hau ea ho tsoa ka kamoreng ea hau ea ho phomola kapa ho shoa. Ho hloekisa li-harepa ho tla qala ho sebetsa letsatsing. Ba tla fuoa tumello ea ho ja kampo efe kapa efe e sa lefelloeng. Lihlooho tsohle tse setseng ka morao li tla kenngoa ka sekoting sa lava.
yo: Tí o bá gbèrò láti dúró sí Camp Half-Blood ní gbogbo ọdún, o gbọ́dọ̀ sọ fún Big House ní ọ̀sán òní. Tí o kò bá kéde èrò rẹ, a máa rò pé o ti kúrò nínú àgọ́ rẹ tàbí kí o kú ikú burúkú. Ṣíṣe ìmọ́tótó harpies yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ nígbà tí oòrùn bá wọ̀. Wọ́n máa fún wọn láṣẹ láti jẹ èyíkéyìí àwọn olùpàgọ́ tí kò forúkọ sílẹ̀. Gbogbo àwọn àpilẹ̀kọ ti ara ẹni tí wọ́n fi sílẹ̀ ni wọ́n máa dáná sun nínú kòtò lava.
tn: Fa e le gore o batla go nna mo ntlong ya gago ya kgwedi le kgwedi, o tshwanetse go itsese ntlo e kgolo ka nako ya motshegare. Fa e le gore ga o kitla o dira dilo tse di bosula, o tla akanya gore o tlogetse ntlo ya gago kgotsa o tlhokafetse ka tsela e e tshosang. Go phepafatsa di-harepa go tla simolola go bereka mo letsatsing. Ba tla ja dimpase tsotlhe tse di sa bonweng. Ditlhogo tsotlhe tse di setseng kwa morago di tla bo di le mo teng ga lepogo.
ty: Mai te mea e opua outou i te faaea i te Puhaparaa no te afa matahiti, e mea ti'a ia outou ia faaara i te Fare Rahi i te avatea i teie mahana. Mai te peu e eita outou e faaite i ta outou mau opuaraa, e mana'o matou e ua faarue outou i to outou piha aore ra ua pohe outou i te hoê pohe riaria mau. E haamata te tamâraa i te mau kinura i te ohipa i te toparaa mahana. E faati'ahia ratou ia amu i te mau huru maa atoa e ere i te mea ino roa. E tutuihia te mau tumu parau atoa i vaiihohia mai i muri nei i roto i te apoo vari auahi.
mai: जँ अहाँ साल भरि कैम्प हाफ-ब्लड मे रहय के इरादा रखैत छी तऽ अहाँके आइ दुपहरिया धरि बिग हाउस के सूचित करय पड़त। जँ अहाँ अपन इरादाक घोषणा नहि करैत छी तँ हम मानि लेब जे अहाँ अपन केबिन खाली कऽ देने छी या भयानक मृत्यु भऽ गेल छी। सूर्यास्त के समय हार्पी के सफाई के काज शुरू भए जाएत। ओ सभ कोनो अपंजीकृत शिविरमे रहनिहार के खयबाक लेल अधिकृत होयत। पाछू छोड़ल गेल सभ व्यक्तिगत वस्तुकेँ लावा गड्ढामे भस्म कऽ देल जायत।
mg: Raha mikasa ny hijanona ao amin'ny Camp Half-Blood ianao mandritra ny taona, dia tsy maintsy mampahafantatra ny Trano Lehibe amin'ny mitatao vovonana androany. Raha tsy manambara ny fikasanao ianao, dia hihevitra izahay fa nandao ny trano fonenanao ianao na maty noho ny fahafatesana mahatsiravina. Hanomboka hiasa amin'ny filentehan'ny masoandro ny fanadiovana ny harpies. Homena alalana hihinana ireo mpitoby tsy voasoratra anarana izy ireo. Ny lahatsoratra manokana rehetra tavela dia hodorana ao amin'ny lavaka lava.

en: We found a shady spot by the creek where I’d broken Clarisse’s spear during my first capture the flag game. We sat on a big rock, drank our Cokes, and watched the sunlight in the woods.
vi: Chúng tôi tìm tán cây cạnh suối nước, đúng chỗ tôi bè giáo của Clarisse hôm trước. Hai anh em ngồi trên tảng đá to, uống nước ngọt ngắm hoàng hôn trong rừng. Hai đứa chuyện phiếm về chiêu thức giành cờ danh dự và nhiều thứ linh tinh khác.
tr: Sonra, ilk bayrak yarışında, Clarisse'nin mızrağını kırdığım derenin yanında gölgelik bir yer bulduk. Kocaman bir kayaya oturarak, kolalarımızı içtik ve ormana vuran güneş ışıklarını seyrettik.
es: Encontramos un lugar en sombra junto al arroyo donde le había roto la lanza a Clarisse durante mi primera partida de capturar la bandera. Nos sentamos en una roca grande, bebimos las Coca-Colas y observamos el paisaje.
es_results: "title": "The Old Man and the Sea", "author": "Ernest Hemingway"
vi_translation: We found a spot under the tree canopy by the stream, right where I had set up Clarisse's raft the other day. The two siblings sat on a large rock, drinking fresh water and watching the sunset in the forest. The two chatted about tactics for capturing the flag of honor and various other miscellaneous topics.
tr_translation: Then, by the creek where I broke Clarisse's spear during the first relay race, we found a shady spot. Sitting on a huge rock, we drank our sodas and watched the sunlight filtering through the forest.
es_translation: We found a shaded spot next to the stream where I had broken Clarisse's spear during my first game of capture the flag. We sat on a big rock, drank the Coca-Colas, and watched the scenery.
st: ʻO ka hoʻoheheʻe ʻana i ka hoʻoheheʻe ʻana i ka ʻike a me ka hoʻoheheʻe ʻana i ka hoʻoheheʻe ʻana i ka ʻike ʻana. Re ile ra lula holim'a lefika le leholo, re noa Cokes ea rona, 'me ra shebella khanya ea letsatsi morung.
yo: A rí ààyè òjìji lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ odò níbi tí mo ti fọ́ ọ̀kọ̀ Clarisse nígbà tí mo kọ́kọ́ gba eré àsíá. A jókòó lórí àpáta ńlá, a mu Cokes wa, a sì wo ìmọ́lẹ̀ oòrùn nínú igbó.
tn: Re ne ra bona lefelo le ke neng ke le mo go lone kwa ke neng ke thuntse lerumo la ga Clarisse fa ke ne ke ntse ke tshameka kgwele ya me ya ntlha. Re ne ra dula mo lefikeng le legolo, ra nwa di-cookie tsa rona, mme ra lebelela letsatsi le le mo sekgweng.
ty: Ua ite matou i te hoê vahi marumaru i pihai iho i te anavai i reira to ' u ofatiraa i te mahae a Clarisse i te taime matamua a haru ai au i te hautiraa o te reva. Ua parahi matou i ni'a i te hoê ofa'i rahi, ua inu i ta matou mau faraoa monamona, e ua mata'ita'i i te maramarama o te mahana i roto i te uru raau.

en: He snapped his fingers. A small fire burned a hole in the ground at my feet. Out crawled something glistening black, about the size of my hand. A scorpion.
vi: Luke búng tay. Đốm lửa nhỏ xuất hiện cạnh chân tôi. Từ đó một con vật đen trũi, dài bằng bàn tay bò ra. Bò Cạp.
tr: Birden parmaklarını şaklattı. Ufak bir ateş, ayağımın dibinde minik bir delik açtı. Delikten, el büyüklüğünde, sürünen bir şey çıktı. Çıkan şey bir akrepti.
es: Chasqueó los dedos y al punto un pequeño fuego abrió un agujero en el suelo a mis pies. Del interior salió reptando algo negro y brillante, del tamaño de mi mano. Un escorpión.
vi_translation: Luke snapped his fingers. A small flame appeared next to my foot. From there, a pitch-black creature, the length of a hand, crawled out. A scorpion.
tr_translation: Suddenly, he snapped his fingers. A small flame opened a tiny hole at my feet. From the hole, something the size of a hand crawled out. The thing that came out was a scorpion.
es_translation: He snapped his fingers and immediately a small fire opened a hole in the ground at my feet. From inside crawled out something black and shiny, the size of my hand. A scorpion.
